loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with 3 children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Esther operates a service-based business to earn a living, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earns 7,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

Esther has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Esther hopes to finish the study of her children and to gain double the income from her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Samon's Group

texts.en:
Samon is 42 years old, widowed and has five children, three of whom are working in Malaysia to complement the family’s income. She has struggled to earn a living in a rural area of the Ratanak Mondul district by planting maize as a primary income for more than 10 years. Sometimes, she works for others at a maize plantation to raise additional income. 

Samon leads a group of three female members, and is applying for the first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to pay for labourers in harvesting her maize. This loan will enable her to harvest all her maize crops to be ready for sale. She also hopes to earn more income to make a better living so as to live all together with her children.

loans.use: to pay for labourers in harvesting her maize

loans.name: Belki Esmeralda

texts.es: Belki Esmeralda de veintiséis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee un tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad arroz, frijoles, leche, pan entre otros últimamente ha aumentado la demanda de sus productos pues todos son de muy buena calidad y a precio accesible además en la tienda de Belki las personas siempre encuentran lo que necesitan; es una mujer joven trabajadora y una madre excepcional, tiene  muchos proyectos a futuro y uno de ellos es estar siempre al frente de la competencia haciendo crecer el negocio y al mismo tiempo sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella piensa que alcanzar el éxito implica estar seguro de él, y Belki está totalmente segura de lo que quiere es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, jabones etc. Belki Esmeralda tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Belki Esmeralda is 26 years old and lives with her partner and their 2 children. She owns a shop where she sells staple products: rice, beans, milk, bread among others. Lately the demand for her goods has increased as they are all of excellent quaity and reasonably priced. In addition, in Belki's shop people always find what they need. Belki is a young, hardworking woman and an outstanding mother. She has many future projects in mind and one of them is to always be ahead of the competition, growing her business while at the same time taking care of her children. She thinks that to be successful you have to be sure you will succeed and Belki is completely sure of what she wants which is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy dry grains, bread, instant products, sweets, drinks, soap. etc. Belki Esmeralda has faith in that with effort she will be able to provide her household with financial security.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, bread, instant products, sweets, drinks, soap.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a 60 year old widow, and a mother of five children. She lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm where she plants, harvests and sells corn to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. 

Leonita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost five years. In the future, she wants to purchase general farm supplies & equipment for the improvement of her farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 23 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She has had a pub in Yei, South Sudan for five years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer and soda to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Reina Esther

texts.es: Reina Esther de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive con su sobrina. Ella posee una venta de ropa y zapatos; camisetas, pantalones, blusas, entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la clientela, pues en su negocio siempre tienen lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable Reina al ser una mujer muy carismática y amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con el mejor de los gustos; ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante,  Reina piensa que para alcanzar el éxito se requiere de voluntad, razón y decisión. Esta muy decidida a salir adelante con el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar camisetas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, zapatos etc. Reina Esther tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina Esther, who is 55 years old, lives with her niece. She sells clothing and shoes: shirts, pants, blouses, among other things. Lately, she has expanded her clientele since, in her business, she always has what people need with excellent quality products and accessible prices. Additionally, the service is unequaled since Reina hs a very charismatic and amiable woman who receives her customers with the best taste. She is a very hard-working woman with desires to get ahead. Reina thinks that to achieve success she needs will, reason and decision. She is focused on getting ahead with the business. It is for this that she is requesting from Integral a loan that allows her to buy shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, shoes, etc. Reina Esther has the faith that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Flutanata

texts.en: Flutanata is a single woman who is committed to her work. For five years, she has operated a grocery store where she sells bananas, avocados, and other items. Her business is located along a busy main road, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of fruit. Flutanata will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruit. Her business goal is to run a big shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush lives together with her husband and mother-in-law. For seven years, the family has earned its main income from agriculture. Siranush needs an investment to cultivate the land. With the requested loan she plans to purchase seeds. This loan will help Siranush to develop agriculture and increase her income. With additional income Siranush will improve her living conditions and insure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a 30 year old married woman, and a mother of one child. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a farm where she plants, harvests and sells rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP. 

Liezel has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost five years. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to help her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 40, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She plants, harvests and sells fruit to earn a living. She has been in this business for the past ten years and now earns 3,000 PHP a month.

Andrea has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 7,469 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un negocio de panadería muy conocido por la localidad donde reside pues prepara el pan mas delicioso pastelitos, peperechas, quesadillas, entre otros, todo hecho con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles, las personas que visitan el negocio siempre quedan satisfechas; Juana es una mujer dedicada al trabajo siempre está a activa y dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten, para ella el éxito es el premio del esfuerzo si se sigue siempre adelante te espera un mejor futuro y es con ese ánimo que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comparar materia prima como harina, azúcar, levadura, bandejas, etc. Juana tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juana, who is 39 years old, lives with her life partner and their children. She has a bakery business well known in the area where she lives since she makes the most delicious bread, cakes, "peperechas," "quesadillas" among other items. Everything is made with the best quality ingredients and at accessible prices. The people who visit the business always are satisfied. Juana is a woman who is dedicated to work, always active and disposed to take advantage of all of the opportunities that present themselves. For her, success is the reward of effort, always ahead if you hope for a better future and it is with that courage that she decided to request from Integral a loan that allows her to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, trays, etc. Juana hope that, in this way, she will be able to provide economic security for her home and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast and trays.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan works as a rice farmer in the urban area of Takhmao. She grows rice crops, both in the rainy season and the dry season. Together with her husband, she has been in this business since 1979. If they are able to increase their production during the year, her husband will sell some of the rice to earn extra income. Kan usually earns an average of $4.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. Currently, two of her children work in a garment factory to help improve the entire family's standard of living.

Kan would like to acquire her first loan from Kiva to buy a pump and fertilizer for her dry-season rice. She hopes that she will be able to increase her rice production through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, and shoes.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en: Maka is 36 years old, married, and has six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for five years.  She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, 24, is single and has no children yet. She is an honest, principled, and God-fearing lady. She sells dresses and material to retail customers. She has been in this business for one year. Margaret's business challenge is insufficient funds to expand her business. She will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy material for clothes. She looks forward to expanding her business and having four employees within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy material for clothes.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa, camisetas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela, por lo tanto ha aumentado la demanda de su producto,  ya que es de muy buena calidad a precios bajos y con un servicio inigualable; Ana es una mujer enérgica totalmente dispuesta a salir adelante piensa que el secreto para llegar al triunfo es la constancia y la dedicación en su trabajo y es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, camisas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc. Ana Yanci tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en: Ana Yanci, 37, lives with her common-law husband and children.  She has a clothes business and sells t-shirts, dresses, and trousers as well as other items.  Lately she has seen an increase in customers and therefore more demand for her products.  She offers good quality at low prices and her service is unequalled.  Ana is an energetic woman who is determined to get ahead.  She believes the secret to success is consistency and dedication to work, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will enable her to buy blouses, shirts, dresses, skirts, trousers, etc.  Ana Yanci is confident that this will  enable her to give her family a fullfilling lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, dresses, skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. El posee una panadería desde ya hace algún tiempo, es muy conocida en la localidad donde vive además tiene un transporte de carga pesada que le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar , se ha hecho ya de mucha clientela pues el pan que venden tiene una sabor exquisito a precios bajos y hechos con materiales de primera calidad; Carlos es un hombre emprendedor con mucho entusiasmo por superarse, quiere estar  un paso adelante de de la competencia para el, él secreto del triunfo esta en el amor y la dedicación que le pongas para realizarlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, agua, y para la gasolina del vehículo para sus viajes. Carlos Alberto tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto, 53, lives with his wife and four children.  He has a bakery which he has been running for some time.  He is very well-known in the town where he lives because he also has a heavy transport business that helps cover household expenses.  He has many customers because his bread is delicious and inexpensive, made from top quality ingredients.  Carlos is an entrepreneur with a lot of enthusiasm to get ahead.  He tries to be one step ahead of his competition and believes the secret to success is in the love and dedication one places in one's work.  He has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy flour, sugar, and water as well as gasoline for his vehicles.  Carlos Alberto is convinced that this will help his family have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and water.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 30 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.  She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes, oil, and sugar to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael de cincuenta años de edad vive con su hijo, el posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, pan, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha más clientela, pues es la tienda mas surtida de la zona y la gente la busca porque siempre encuentran todo lo que necesitan a precios muy accesibles y con productos de muy buena calidad, además el servicio que presta Rafael es inigualable siempre recibe a la gente con una sonrisa en el rostro; él es un hombre trabajador se levanta desde muy temprano a empezar su labor para aprovechar su tiempo, piensa que detrás de alguien con éxito, está una decisión valiente,  el ya tomo su decisión y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, lácteos, bebidas, jabones etc. Rafael tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rafael, 50, lives with his son and runs a grocery store.  He sells essential goods such as beans, bread and milk, among other items.  Lately he has noticed an increase in customers since his store has the widest variety in the area and people can always find what they are looking for at low prices.  Rafael offers very good quality and an unequaled service, since he always receives customers with a smile.  He is a hard worker and gets up early in the morning to get a good start.  He believes that behind a successful person there is a courageous decision.  He took the decision to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, instant products, sausage, dairy products, beverages, soaps, etc.  Rafael is confident this will help him give his family a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant products, sausage, dairy products, beverages and soaps.

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop, 33, is a loving mother of three unmarried children. She is from the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, where she works as a farmer. She is usually busy farming every day because she grows her rice crops twice a year, relying on water from a nearby river during the dry season. Since she divorced her husband, she has worked even harder to provide her children's basic necessities, especially education.

Nop is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle for the family’s use, which would provide them with a more comfortable life. In the future, she hopes to own a store and sell many kinds of fresh vegetables to the people in her community.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for the family’s use.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en: Jacklin is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.  She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is 39 years old and is married to Flordeliza. Benedicto is a farmer in the Philippines, and he plants and harvests rice to sell. His business has been very helpful for him and his family. His income from the business provides their food. 

Benedicto has experience in this field for almost 15 years. His income depends on the weather, but he states that most of his income comes from his crops, earning up to P45,000 per season. He has no other source of income. As a result, he is requesting a loan of  P25,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his rice production.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his rice production

loans.name: Zaira Yesenia

texts.es: Zaira Yesenia de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una panadería y al mismo tiempo una tortillería,  esto le ayuda a solventar las necesidades del hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues las personas  siempre encuentran lo que necesitan a precios accesibles y con productos de muy buena calidad; Zaira es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro, uno de sus propósitos a futuro es que su negocio crezca y quiere empezar desde ya a forjar las bases, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, agua, aceite, entre otros. Zaira Yesenia tiene la esperanza que así logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejora calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Zaira Yesenia, 30, lives with her common-law husband and children in their own house.  She has a bakery and also runs a tortilla-making business which helps take care of household expenses.  She has many customers since they can always find top quality products at low prices.  Zaira is very charismatic and hard-working and always receives her customers with a smile on her face.  One of her goals for the future is to expand her business so she wants to strengthen its foundations and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will enable her to buy wholesale flour, sugar, water, and oil, among other items.  Zaira Yesenia hopes this will help her provide economic stability and a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale flour, sugar, water and oil.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Khorn, 44, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a business selling handbags. Her husband is motor-taxi driver. Her son is employed as a construction worker in Thailand. 

Khorn is asking for a loan of USD 800 to raise capital to buy more handbags to resell in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. In the future, she would like to expand her business, selling handbags in larger numbers, and to build a new home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more handbags to resell.

loans.name: Azizkan

texts.ru: Азизкан 51 год, замужем.  Азизкан работает учителем в местной школе, муж – лесник местного лесного хозяйства. После распада Советского Союза, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Азизкан начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 500 советских рублей, Азизкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 4 коровы, 10 овец и одну лошадь, приносящее около 15,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азизкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В ближайшем будущем, Азизкан планирует вложить доходы в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Azizkan is 51 years old and married. Azizkan works as a teacher in the local school. Her husband is a forest ranger. After the collapse of the Soviet Union,  Azizkan started her cattle breeding business in order to make more money for her family. With her start-up capital of 500 Soviet rubles, Azizkan started her farm, which now has four cows, ten sheep, and one horse, producing about 15,000 som from the sale of milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business, Azizkan contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som to purchase additional livestock. In the near future, Azizkan plans to invest any revenue to increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 48 years old and has a son. Ha and her husband have been earning a living by operating a general store from the front of their house for the past fourteen years. They sell a variety of goods, such as sugar, candies, basic household necessities, and beverages.

Ha would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing more products in bulk. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is a 50-year-old widow. She lives with her son in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a food stall in front of their house for the past two years. She sells soups and noodles to people in her community. 

Nguyet would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing more furniture and cooking appliances. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and cooking appliances.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida. Ella posee una tienda la cual es muy conocida en la localidad pues en ella los clientes encuentran todo lo que necesitan arroz, frijoles, leche, golosinas, entre otros, todos productos de muy buena calidad a precios realmente accesibles  además el servicio que les ofrece es excepcional. Ana es una mujer emprendedora con muchas metas por delante uno de sus objetivos es hacer crecer su negocio y está trabajando duro para lograrlo ella piensa que se alcanza el éxito convirtiendo cada paso en una meta y cada meta en un paso esto la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, embutido, bebido etc. Ana Miriam tiene fe que así logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Miriam, 39, lives with her common-law husband.  She has a store which is very well-known in the town because customers always find everything they need such as rice, beans, milk, sweets, etc.  All of the products are top quality and prices are really low.  The service provided is also exceptional.  Ana is an enterprising woman with many goals.  One of them is to expand her business and she is working hard to achieve it.  She believes one becomes successful by converting each step into a goal and each goal into another step, and this is what has motivated her to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, sausage, beverages, etc.  Ana Miriam believes that this will enable her family to lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, bread, instant products, sausage and beverages.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela, 61, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 9 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP. 

Rosela has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more products to resell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to resell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 29 years old, married, and has one child who does not attend school.  She has had a business of selling bananas and bread in Yei, South Sudan for four years.  She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bananas and bread to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and bread to sell.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports the family by selling electronic products. 

For 10 years, Tien has earned a living by running a general store. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, candies, and soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which would help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak, 32, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband, Duk, is a rice farmer. Besides growing rice, Duk purchases rice to resell at the rice mill to earn extra income during the harvest season. 

Heak is requesting a loan of USD 400 to raise capital for her husband to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill. In the future, she hopes to invest more money into expanding her husband’s business. In addition, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Lucinda De Los Santos

texts.es: Lucinda de los Santos de sesenta y uno años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un molino de nixtamal con el que presta servicio en la zona donde reside además se dedica a la venta de maíz, es muy conocida en la localidad pues el servicio es muy bueno y los clientes siempre quedan satisfechos además los precios y la calidad del trabajo es excelente; Lucinda es una mujer muy activa, siempre trabajando duro para forjarse un futuro mejor, para ella el  éxito se obtiene solo con pensamiento firme y seguro de saber lo que se quiere llegar a ser, Lucinda está segura de su meta es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita dar mantenimiento al molino y para la compra de maíz por mayor y otros. Lucinda de los Santos tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Lucinda de los Santos is 61 and lives with her husband and children. She has a corn grinder that she allows others in the neighborhood to use and she also sells corn.  She is well-known in her area and many people seek out her services and corn, as she sells at a good price and the quality of her product is excellent.  Lucinda is very active and works hard to improve her quality of life and succeed through personal determination.  Lucinda seeks this credit from INTEGRAL to carry out maintenance for her corn grinder and to buy a wholesale quantity of corn. Lucinda de los Santos has great faith in a better future for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a wholesale quantity of corn

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
Cecilio is 29 years old and has been married for three years. He has no children yet but hopes to have one in the future. He has been growing rice since he got married. He is not able to seek other employment so he does farming activities. Income generated from this business is the only source of income. He usually earns about P20,000 each harvest season (April and November).

He now has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy six bags of rice seeds, fertilizer and seven liters of insecticide to use in farming. He would like to improve his crop production to increase his sales and earnings. 

.

loans.use: to buy six bags of rice seeds, fertilizer and seven liters of insecticide to use in farming

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng is a diligent mother who earns a living by growing rice and vegetable crops in Takhmao town. She is an experienced farmer because she has been engaged in farming for 26 years.  She typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day through her effort. Currently her two daughters are working in a garment factory as sewing staff to help support the living. 

This loan of $700 will enable Mrs. Seng to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter for the whole family to live as before she has lived on her neighbor’s land. But soon this piece of land will be sold to another owner. She is very happy and appreciative to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter.

loans.name: Tumalu

texts.en:
Tumalu is a 42 year-old a married woman with five children. two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Tumalu is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase fish. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora del Carmen  vive con hijo, ella posee una venta de ropa y confesión,  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como pantalones, blusas, camisas, vestidos entre otros; es muy conocida en la localidad pues siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita con producto de calidad y a precios bajos, además su servicio es excelente siempre satisface los gustos de su clientela; Dinora es una mujer emprendedora siempre está luchando por conseguir su éxito, para ella el más grande secreto para llegar a ese triunfo es la constancia y el valor de seguir el camino, Dinora sabe que está en el camino correcto y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL n crédito que le permita comprar  ropa por mayor y diferentes telas. Dinora del Carmen tiene la confianza que esto le  ayudara a darle una mejor  calidad de vida a la familia.
texts.en: Dinora del Carmen lives with her son. She sells clothing for women, men and children like pants, shirts, dresses and other items. She is very well known in her area because she always has what the customers need and she has good quality products with low prices. In addition, her customer service is excellent and always satisfies her customers’ tastes. Dinora is a very enterprising woman. She is always fighting to obtain success. For her, her biggest secrets for reaching this triumph are perseverance and the value of following a path. Dinora knows that she is on the right path. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to purchase wholesale clothing and different fabrics. Dinora del Carmen is confident that this will help her give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing and fabrics.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is married and has two children aged seven and fifteen years. She is an honest woman. She has been selling groceries such as sugar, rice, flour etc. for the last two years. She faces business challenge of insufficient funds for expansion. She will use the loan of  Kes 20,000 in order to buy two bags of sugar and add stock of groceries to sell such as rice and flour.  In the future,Tabitha looks forward to having a shopping mall in the next five years.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar and add stock of other groceries she sells  such as rice and flour.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 61 years-old and married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband helps her to manage a general store.

Em runs a store at her house that sells many kinds of food, snacks, instant noodles, milk, fruit-juice bottles, and shampoo for the people in her community. She started this business seven years ago.

Em would like to take a loan to buy a large quantity of products to sell to her customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of products such as food and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is 40 year-old a married woman with two children. one of them is in school.  She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Besta is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru:
Айнуре 38 лет, замужем, имеет четверых  детей, младшей их которых два года. Айнура по профессии – учительница и преподавала кыргызский язык и литературу в местной школе. В настоящее время Айнура находится в декретном отпуске.
В поисках источника дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, в 2005 году Айнура начала свой бизнес в разведении, откорме и перепродаже скота, начав с начальной суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS).  На сегодняшний день,  в ее хозяйстве насчитывается  четыре голов коров, десять  баранов и две лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в ремонт кошары для обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Ainura is 38 years old, married, and has four children, the youngest of whom is two years old. Ainura is a teacher by profession and she teaches the Kirghiz language and literature at a local school. Currently Ainura is on maternity leave. Searching for a source of additional income to support her family, in 2005 Ainura stared a business breeding, fattening, and reselling cattle. She started with 20,000 som in capital. Now, her farm has four cows, ten sheep and two horses. In order to further develop her business, Ainura contacted Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som to buy additional livestock. With income from the loan, Ainura plans to invest in repairing her barn to improve living conditions for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies for her beauty shop.

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es: María Catalina de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una tienda muy surtida donde vende productos de consumo básico como frijoles, leche, pan, huevos entre otros, desde hace poco tiempo la demanda en su negocio ha aumentado y María no quiere decepcionar a su clientela y quiere abastecer la tienda con mas productos de buena calidad y por supuesto a un buen precio ; María es una mujer muy enérgica siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas, para ella el éxito en la vida consiste en seguir siempre adelante, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  productos instantáneo, granos básicos, aceites, condimentos, bebidas etc. María Catalina tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá llevar a su hogar  seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: María Catalina is 34 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has a general goods store and sells products such as beans, milk, bread, eggs and other items.  Demand for her products has increased over time and María wants to stock a better variety of items at attractive prices; María is an active woman that believes in getting ahead through personal effort.  For this reason she seeks this credit from INTEGRAL to stock her store with varied items such as instant food products, staples, grains, oil, spices, soft drinks. María Catalina has faith that her hard work will lead to a better future for her family.

loans.use: instant food products, staples, oil, spices, soft drinks

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario lives with his family in the town of Alicia, Isabela. He is 55 years old and a father of five adult children. Apolinario is engaged in the hog-raising business, primarily for breeding. He has been in this business for 18 years. Through the income he generates from his business he has been able to  provide food for his family's needs and also support the extended family. 

At this time, Apolinario is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. Apolinario wishes to have a higher income from the business so he will have his own savings. He says he is getting older and that's why he wants to build his savings in preparation for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 38 years old and the mother of two children.  She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over nine years. They sell noodles and many kinds of dishes for breakfast and lunch. 

Diep is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase better quality materials to make food she can sell.  She hopes this will help her earn more money so she can reinvest in her business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy new furniture for her stall and purchase better quality materials to make food for selling.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut is a 58-year-old, married woman with six children (two sons and four daughters).  Her husband works as a driver for hire.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past 12 years, she has run a food stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees.  The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chopsticks and better quality food and beverages for her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: buy new furniture, dishes and food for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase goats to resell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 35-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 1 son and 2 daughters. 

For ten years, Hong has owned a general store. She would like a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock in her store. Hong is hoping that this will enable her to meet the needs of her existing customers, as well as attracting additional customers. 

Hong hopes this will help her business generate a higher income so she can save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to stock in her store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 23 years old and married with two sons. She lives with her husband, a deliveryman, and their children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ly supports her family by sewing woolen clothing in her home. She would like to use the loan to buy wool and materials so she can increase her production of woolen clothing. 

Ly hopes that by doing this, her business will run smoothly, she will help improve her family's living conditions and she will be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy wool and materials to increase her production of woolen clothing.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married with a two year old daughter. To earn a living, she sells knitting yarns and pullovers to retail customers. She has been doing this for two years. 

Nancy has a business challenge of insufficient funds; however, she is honest and a woman of integrity, who hopes to expand her business in the next five years and become a supplier. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy knitting yarns and clothing materials.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarns and clothing materials.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn has spent most of her life cultivating rice and vegetable crops from an urban area of Takhmao town. She is very hard-working in order to ensure that her crops are well-grown. After her vegetable crops are ripe enough, Mrs. Vorn harvests and brings them home to one of her daughters who is in a selling business in Takhmao market where she acts as a fruit and vegetable seller. 

And now Mrs. Vorn has applied for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva partners, to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables to support her daughter’s business. Vorn hopes to improve her family’s businesses and have a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables to support her daughter’s business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old and married. She has four children. Leonora has only completed an elementary school education. She cooks and sells daily meals and snacks to the people in her village. This is the source of her income. She enjoys cooking food and her specialty is to cook pansit  (noodles topped with egg, meat and vegetables). She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Leonora would like to further develop her business. She has insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy eggs, pork, cabbage and noodles to cook and sell.

Someday, Leonora would like to cook different types of meals so that she may keep satisfying her customer's demand for delicious food. This way, she could earn more profit and make her family more successful.

loans.use: to buy eggs, pork, cabbage and noodles to cook and sell

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Irene is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her small business, which makes clothes using a borrowed sewing machine. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy her own sewing machines and new material, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay medical expenses and take care of her family. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Irene's future prospects by helping her to learn more about womanhood and how to succeed financially.

loans.use: to buy her own sewing machines and new material

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jovia has been working hard to manage her market stand, which sells fresh fruits. 

To help expand her business, Jovia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruit, and will help Jovia to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Jovia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car and a plot of land to build on. 

Jovia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jovia's future prospects by helping her to learn more about herself and about finance.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Satria 2 Group

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is married and now she is 38 years old. She is a mother of three children. They are 18 years old, 15 years old and 13 years old. She has been selling vegetable soup since 2009 from her house. She also sells fried snacks. The business is running smoothly and she can generate income to help her husband sustain the family. Her husband is a part-time laborer and only works if there is an order. She is taking this loan to buy more vegetables and to make more varieties of vegetable soup. She likes to do this business because people like to eat her vegetable soup.

In the future, she wants to rent a space to open a small restaurant. She also hopes her children can finish studying at the University.

loans.use: to pay for more vegetables such as spinach and carrot to cook and sell.

loans.name: Julanda

texts.en: Julanda is married and has five children ranging from sixteen to twenty eight years old. She is honest and a woman with leadership qualities. She practices farming and she sells vegetables such as potatoes. She has been in this business for the last six years. In addition, she works at a local government office so to increase her income. Her business challenge is insufficient capital since this is her first loan. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy farming products like seeds. She hopes to expand her business so as to get enough capital for running another similar business.

loans.use: To buy more farming products such as seeds.

loans.name: Satria 1 Group

texts.en:
Kosiah is 47 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling pepes ikan (steamed fish with special seasoning) since 2010 from her house. The business is going well. The income that she generates can help her to pay for her children's school fees. Her husband sells calves and the income is already enough to buy meals. She really likes to sell pepes ikan because people around her neighborhood really like it and the food is always sold out. Sometimes she faces a problem with an increase in the price of the ingredients. Now she wants to use her loan to buy more fish to produce more pepes ikan to sell. In the future, she wants to continuously send give her children a better education. She also hopes she can have her own restaurant to sell pepes ikan.

Other group members are using their part of loan to improve their businesses, which include selling cell phone minute refills and selling peyek (an Indonesian snack).

loans.use: to pay for more fish to produce pepes ikan( steamed fish with special seasoning) to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with six children. Three of them are in school. She has had a business of selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 49-year-old mixed-crop farmer; he is married to Joyce, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 25. Julius has been rearing pigs for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 to support his family.

Julius is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he hopes to start exporting pig products, which will increase his profits and help him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 41-year-old enterprising businessman.  He is married to Phyllis, who is a tailor. They are blessed with three children aged 10, 9, and 5. Simon has been running a retail shop for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he combines with his wife's income to support his family.

Simon is applying for his fourth loan with KADET after repaying his previous loans successfully. Simon will use the loan to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his shop.

He hopes to educate his children up to the university level and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop.

loans.name: Macelina

texts.en: Macelina is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for one year. Macelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 49-year-old businesswoman and pig farmer. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children. Alice has been rearing pigs for the one year, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alice will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. She hopes to own a big pig farm and become a leader in pig farming.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the money supply for her money-transfer service.

loans.name: Salome Nyambura

texts.en: Salome is a married woman with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 14. She describes herself as determined and committed to her business. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall where she sells food and drinks, such as tea. Her primary customers are residents and masons. She describes her biggest business challenge as the increased price of ingredients. Salome will use the requested loan of KES 20,000 to buy cooking supplies such as flour, cooking oil, and charcoal. Her business goal is to run a big hotel [restaurant] within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies such as flour, oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Delaide

texts.en:
Delaide is a 49-year-old mixed-crop farmer. His wife, Virginia, is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. Delaide has been rearing pigs for the past 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Delaide will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

In the future, he hopes to export pig products, thus earning more profits that will help him improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better manure, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Roeurng is a 58-year-old married woman residing in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is the mother of 5 children and works as a farmer.  She grows rice crops twice a year alongside her husband on their farmland. Some of her children also assist them in farming, in addition to attending classes at school. 

The family has encountered many difficulties related to transportation. Currently, Roeurng doesn’t own a motorcycle, so she has decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle that will provide the family with reliable transportation. If she has enough money, Roeurng hopes to repair some parts of her house because it’s too old and hard to live in.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Jacklin

texts.en: Jacklin is a 20-year-old -married woman with one child who is not in school. She has run a food stall in Yei, South Sudan, for two years. Jacklin requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a hardworking woman who is in the business of selling water. She has been doing this for the last five years and has been able to support her family with her business. Jane was introduced to KADET by an existing women's group in her area. She has been a good client who has repaid her previous loans without delay. 

Jane is requesting her third loan that she will use to buy more pumps to aid in water distribution. She hopes to save her profit to invest in buying a second-hand pickup truck to distribute water. Jane dreams of being very rich and financially stable in future.

loans.use: to buy water distribution pumps

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old and the married father of three children who are all in school. For the past 15 years, he has been a maize farmer. George learned about KADET from another registered client. He just joined KADET and this will be his first loan.

George is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs such as maize seed and fertilizer, and to hire manpower to aid in the farm. He hopes to use the profit from his loan to expand his farm from small-scale to commercial. George's dream is to become a large-scale farmer and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jane Mueni

texts.en:
Jane is a 23-year-old single woman who does not have children. For the past year, she has operated a pharmacy. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are all kinds of people, mostly patients. Jane describes herself as determined and ambitious. Her biggest business challenge is the high cost of medicines. 

Jane is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more medicines. Within the next five years, her goal is to run a big hospital.

loans.use: to buy medicines

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhang is 32 and is married with three children, all of whom are under her care and attending school. She lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Chhang is a farmer and rice farming is her sole source of income. 

Mrs. Chhang is requesting a loan from Kiva funders to buy stocks of rice at a low price during the harvesting season. She hopes to resell her rice at a profit when there is increased market demand. Mrs. Chhang plans to save money to provide for her children’s education after they finish high school. She is very happy and grateful for help.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Simukai Tailors Association Group

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mukai from Harare. She is married with three children, two attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Mukai runs a business tailoring clothes. The business has been in operation for the past two years. She says the main challenge faced is marketing as she does everything on her own, which means she needs someone to source a market for her. 

Mukai has requested a loan of $400 to buy materials for general tailoring. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future Mukai plans to employ five people.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabrics, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to meet her training expenses and purchase new machines.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 40 years old, a married woman with seven children. Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Edina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts, maize, and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, maize, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Simbaredenga Group

texts.en:
This is Joseph, 47, from Machipisa, Harare. He is married and has four children, three still at school. He also cares for his parents from his rural home. 

Joseph runs a services business specializing in sewing men's wear of various ranges. His business has been in operation for four years. He indicated that the main challenge he faces is that electricity is in short supply, which can sometimes reduce production. 

Joseph has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothing materials and a small generator. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to send his children to a better school. In the future, Joseph plans to have a big generator to use during power outages.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes from across the borders for resale.

loans.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
Kadriye, an entrepreneurial 34-year-old married woman and mother of a ten-year-old, has been in the printing business for ten years. She prints things such as stamps, seals, invitations and official invoices.  

She needs to replace her typeset letters and machines. With this loan, she will buy a typesetting machine, which will enable her to produce higher quality products more quickly. 

In the future, she would like to print different types of foreign cards, which requires more capital. She also wants to be able to attain the materials required to produce invitations herself.  By doing her work better in these ways, she wants to secure her child’s future. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff and volunteers 

Kadriye Hanım, 34 yaşında ve evli. 10 yaşında bir çocuğu var.  Maatbaacılık işini 10 yıldır yapıyor.  Kaşe,mühür,davetiye basımı,resmi  fatura gibi evrakların basımını yapıyor.  Dizgi harfleri ve makineleri yenilemek gerekiyor.  Kaşe ve mühür yapımında kullandıkları makine hurdaya çıkmış.  Bu kredi ile kaşe makinesi alacak.  Böylece daha seri ve daha iyi iş yapabilecek.  Yurt dışından gelen bir kart türlerinin üretimini kendisi yapmak istiyor.  Ancak bunun için büyük sermaye gerekli.  Gelecekte,davetiye üretimi için gerekli malzemeyi alabilmek.  Çocuğunun geleceğini teminat altına almak istiyor,bu yüzden işini çok daha iyi yapmak istiyor.  Kadriye Hanım,girişimci bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy a typesetting machine.

loans.name: Kwayedza Group

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Entineth from Machipisa, a high-density surbub in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother of two children.

Entineth runs a business of selling clothes that she buys from local shops as well as from Zambia. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges she faces are low business activity due the mid-month and competition from established shops. 

Entineth has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. 

In the future Entineth plans to be operating a big and well-stocked clothing shop in the city center.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bulk groundnuts.

loans.name: Tipapa

texts.en:
Tipapa is 30 years old, married and with his wife they have two children. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. 

He learned about KADET through an advertisement done by KADET in the area where he lives. He is currently applying for his third loan with KADET, with which he plans to buy maize seeds for planting and also chemicals for spraying. 

He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who can achieve more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children who lives in Prey Chor district. 

Sem and her husband are local farmers, cultivating rice crops for their livelihoods. Together, they typically yield an average of $4.00 per day to satisfy the family’s needs. Since two of the children are in secondary school, the basic necessities seem to be increasing. 

Sem wants to get involved in another business to solve her problem and sustain her living. Therefore, she would like a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle that can be used to buy and collect recycled materials through the commune. Sem hopes this new business will help her to protect her family against poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sanare

texts.en:
Sanare is 36 years old, married and they have five children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET Ltd. to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers and to buy more animals. He has been a good client who hopes to make profits that he plans to use to educate his children and expand his farming activities.

He hopes to make profit and re-invest it in other business. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Kamotsi Group

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Eve from Machipisa, Harare. She is widowed with three children, all of whom attend school. Eve also takes care of an orphan who is in first grade. For the past 15 years, she has run a business tailoring school uniforms. Her main business challenges are an erratic power supply and stiff competition. 

Eve is requesting a 400 USD loan to buy fabric and other tailoring materials. She plans to use the extra income generated with her loan to improve her family's diet and pay school fees. In the future, Eve plans to own a factory and employ workers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tailoring materials

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont tous vont a l’école, ayant arête ses études en classe de troisième, avec la charge de sa famille il se lance dans le commerce des chaussures en 2000, avec le peu d’argent qu’il avait reçu d’un parent, il prenait des chaussures auprès de certains fournisseurs et vendait au marche.
Ayant déjà  bénéficie du prêt de Hope, aujourd’hui, il a son propre capital, il achète sa marchandises au comptant , il a fait des bénéfices énormes et a une forte épargne, il a eu a faire  des remboursements avec beaucoup de succès.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock de sa marchandises en achetant des sandales des enfants hommes et dames. Son activité lui procure beaucoup de satisfaction puisqu’il arrive a prendre soin de sa famille , a payer les frais d’écolage de ses enfants et a épargner aussi pour ses projets futurs ceux d’ouvrir un grand magasin pour chaussures
texts.en: This borrower is 41 years old.  He is married and the father of four children who all attend school.  He is educated up to 9th grade.  Having to provide for his family, and with a little money received from a relative, he decided to go into the shoe business in 2000, and started to acquire shoes from various suppliers and to sell them at a market.  Thanks to a previous loan from Hope, he now has his own capital, buys his merchandise in cash, has made good profits and saved a large amount of money.  He was able to successfully pay-off his loan.  A new loan will allow Jean Pierre to buy sandals for children, men and women, and therefore to increase his stock of merchandise.  His activity has been very satisfying since he can now take care of his family, pay school tuition for his children, and save enough money toward future plans, such as opening a large shoe shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paraffin

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, Christine has operated a photocopy machine business and she also sells stationery from a shop to her neighbors. Her major business challenge is seasonality in her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Christine is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase stationery for her shop. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s demand.

loans.use: to purchase stationery for her shop

loans.name: Noel Nestor

texts.fr:
Ce client est celibataire et a quatre enfant, il a deja bénéficie de plusieurs prêt de Hope , et a rembourse avec succès ses differents prêts et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Le changement est très positif dans sa vie sociale et financière , il est entrain d'élargir son étalage.

Avec ce quatrième cycle, il va renforcer le stock des ses marchandises, en achetant les tuyaux PVC,des câbles électriques,des ampoules de tous genre , des néons, des robinets des pointes et des sanitaires  tous ce dont  les clients ont besoin.
Pour le futur il veut ouvrir un magasin de quincaillerie, et avec ses benefices il s'occupe de sa famille et de leur scolarite
texts.en:
This client is unmarried and has four children. He has already benefitted from several loans from Hope, successfully reimbursed his different loans, and accumulated considerable savings.

The change in his social and financial life has been very positive, and he is expanding his display.

With this fourth loan cycle, he is going to strengthen his stock of merchandise, by buying PVC pipes, electric cables, all types of lightbulbs, neons, faucets, sparkplugs, bathroom fittings and everything his clients need.

For the future, he wants to open a hardware store, and with the profits look after his family and their schooling.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipes, electric cables, all types of lightbulbs, neons, faucets, sparkplugs, bathroom fittings and everything his clients need.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 41 and is married with five children. Two of her children attend school and three are still too young for school. Pauline owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past nine years, she has operated a hardware shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Pauline is requesting a 70,000 KES loan to purchase logs and timber for her hardware shop. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase wood and timber

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 and married. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, Mary has operated an electronics shop, selling to local area customers. Her major business challenge is price fluctuation. Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase electronics to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr:
Cliente de 46 ans, celibataire avec et mère d'un enfant ,en 1993,  elle se lance dans la vente des chaussures pour enfants , ayant remboursée avec succès ses differents prêts, elle se décide d'en prendre un nouveau autre pour élargir son activité, elle élargie son activité en ajoutant  des robes et des chaussures pour enfants  des baby boots, des sandales en cuir , des baskets et des robes des filles , des habits pour garçons.

Sa stratégie est de choisir des habits de bonne qualité et vendre a des prix  abordables.Son commerce lui a procure beaucoup de bienfaits, puisqu'elle se prend en charge, elle paye les frais d'écolage de son enfant .
Pour l'avenir , elle a des grandes ambitions et avoir son propre magasin.
texts.en:
Yolande is a 46-year-old client, unmarried, and mother to one child. In 1993 she began selling children's shoes. Having successfully reimbursed her different loans, she decided to request another one to expand her business. She is expanding her business by adding dresses and children's shoes, baby boots, leather sandals, sneakers, girls' dresses and boys' outfits.

Her strategy is to choose good quality clothing and to sell it at affordable prices. Her business has brought her many benefits, because she takes care of herself and she pays her child's school fees.

For the future, she has the big goal of having her own store.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes  and dresses and clothes for kids

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Lamrana is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lamrana was born in Kamasikie village about thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has two children who are attending primary schools. Lamrana sells palm oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been doing business for four years now. 

With the help of this loan, Lamrana and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. She will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, Maggi cubes, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, 24, is a married man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a food market for his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.


With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to business to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mrs. Davaa, 45 is a seamstress in a company which makes clothes. She has been working as a seamstress for over 20 years. She started her job at this company in 2003. During the past 20 years she had made very many kinds of outfits for sale. Davaa lives with her husband and her 2 children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She decided to run her own leather clothes shop beyond her job or on her days-off. It is important and beneficial to increase her family income for serving her family necessities in enough. Initially she needs to build her working capital and buy equipments such as a sewing machine for leather material. She is planning to purchase the new sewing machine which is made in Japan. It costs about MNT 1.500.000 in the market. Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase the sewing machine to start the new business beyond her job.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start a new business beyond her job.

loans.name: Zvikomborero Group

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Joyce from  Machipisa, Harare, a widow with four children, one still at school. Joyce runs a business tailoring baby wear. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenge faced is getting top quality fabrics due to lack of funds. Joyce has requested a loan of $400 to buy top of the range quality fabric. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her business level and make payment of school fees. In the future Joyce plans to have a big factory and employing a minimum of 10 employees.

loans.use: to buy good quality fabric.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 30, is a married man who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past one year, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of establishing a grocery store business in the future. He dreams of accessibility of loans to boost his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and renovate his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and renovate his business.

loans.name: Sivy's Group

texts.en:
Sivy is a 48-year-old mother of four children who are still in school and sometimes work for others to raise additional income. She is a peasant who has been planting maize for more than 10 years to support her family, and her husband is a carpenter. She has been with VisionFund for five years. Her previous loans have helped her to have regular income, have sufficient food to eat, and send her children to school. 

Sivy and her group member, who has been with VisionFund for one year, are applying for another loan from VisionFund. She wants to use all of her portion of the loan to harvest her maize crop and to buy some materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to increase her business and generate a greater income so she can set aside some money and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to harvest her maize and to buy materials for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya, 46 runs a passenger transportation business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her business since 2005 and already she has permanent customers. Her monthly earning does not meet with her family necessities often. She lives with her children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. 
Lately her business income has been reduced notably in due to damages in her minivan. It influences badly to the number of rides she can provide in a day.  And she could not provide the satisfaction and security of service to her customers. Therefore she decided to make renovation to her minivan. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the spare-parts for the renovation of her minivan.

loans.use: To purchase the spare-parts for the renovation of her minivan.

loans.name: Portal Group

texts.en:
Numu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Numu is thirty-eight years of age. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school.  Numu sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, sugar, mints, sardines, pens and pencils, etc. She has been in business for the past seven years. 

With the help of this loan, Numu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Numu will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, sugar, mints, sardines, pens and pencils, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28-year-old married woman with three children; one of whom is in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for two years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spaghetti.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Regina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past four years, Regina has been working hard to manage her small business which makes and sells cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava and will help Regina to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to start a big retail shop. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Regina's future prospects by helping her to learn more about herself and how to improve her relationship with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Moreen's Group

texts.en:
