Moreen's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Moreen is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells second-hand clothing.

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land to build a house on.

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Moreen's future prospects by helping her to develop life goals.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina, a 23-year-old married woman with two children, neither of whom is in school, has a business selling fish in Yei South Sudan.  In business for the past two years, Sina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more fish to sell. She will use the resulting extra income to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase electronic devices (Play Station, TV, DVD player).

loans.name: Kurban

texts.en:
Kurban, from the village of Kasumlo, East Georgia, is 63 years old and lives with his wife, Sanabar, and his 28-year-old son. The family has a small dairy farm, their main source of income, and Kurban and Sanibar sell milk in the village. They also have a greenhouse where they grow vegetables which Kurban sells to local retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris.

Kurban is requesting this loan to purchase a milk cow. With the resulting increased income, Kurban and Sanabar will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow for expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Heriberto Ulises

texts.es: Heriberto Ulises de 27 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su  esposa la cual se dedica a las tareas del hogar. Heriberto se dedica a los negocios, posee un ciber el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Este negocio es el que le permite mantener a su familia ya que él es el que mantiene la economía del hogar. Es un  hombre muy emprendedor el cual ha sabido manejar el negocio de ciber en el que  también presta otros servicios como de fotocopiadora y principalmente videojuegos. Este negocio es muy rentable y cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus servicios. Gracias a su profesionalismo en el trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona,  los cuales cada día lo prefieren más.  Últimamente ha notado que los videojuegos atraen a muchas personas principalmente a jóvenes y niños que les encanta pasar tiempo entretenidos con los diversos juegos que él proporciona. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de una pantalla LCD y  un Play Station 3, con el fin de atraer a más jóvenes y niños que son los que más frecuentan el negocio. De esta forma espera lograr un aumento en sus ingresos que le permitan seguir viviendo en las condiciones adecuadas para él y para  su querida esposa.
texts.en: Heriberto Ulises is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his wife who takes care of the household chores. Heriberto is a businessman and has an internet cafe which is his main source of income. This business allows him to take care of his family as he is the sole breadwinner in the family. He is a very enterprising man who has known how to manage the internet business and combine it with other services such as photocopying and primarily video games. This business is very profitable and every day more people seek out his services. Thanks to his professional attitude to work he has managed to earn the trust of many people in the area, who with each passing day prefer his services more. Lately he has noticed that the video games attract a lot of people mainly young people and children who love spending time being entertained by the different games he offers. This has led him to take the decision of asking INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in the purchase of an LCD screen and a Play Station 3 in order to attract more young people and children who frequent his business most often. In this way he hopes to increase his revenue so that he and his dear wife can continue to live in acceptable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an LCD screen and a Play Station 3.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl de 33 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos los cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Para Raúl lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para poder dar el pan de cada día y cubrir las necesidades más necesarias. Raúl se dedica a la producción y venta de pan. Posee una panadería en la cual vende variedad  de deliciosos panes. Tiene 14 años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya ha adquirido muchos años de experiencia, además ha logrado establecer algunos clientes que son muy fieles al servicio que él ofrece. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales, en mejores condiciones que las que él ha tenido. Esta es la razón por la que lucha con todas sus fuerzas para mantener vivo el negocio que por muchos años les ha proporcionado lo necesario para sobrevivir. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio es decir poder tener la capacidad de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere mayores ingresos. Esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (harina, azúcar, canela, agua, huevos, colorantes, aceite, etc.), que le permita lograr su objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le genere una mejora en los ingresos percibidos de tal forma que su calidad de vida y la de su familia puedan mejorar con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Raúl is 33 years old and lives in his own house with his family which comprises his partner and 2 children who are currently in their first years at school. The most important thing for Raúl is his family and it is for them that he works hard to give them their daily bread and cover the most basic necessities. Raúl makes and sells bread. He owns a bakery where he sells a variety of delicious breads. He has been in the business for 14 years which has given him a lot of experience. In addition he has managed to establish a very loyal client base of several customers for the service he offers. His dream is to see his children become professonals, with better living conditions than he himself has had. This is the reason why he works hard with all his might to keep the business alive, a business which for many years has allowed them to survive. His dream is to expand the business to have the capacity to meet increased demand to generate more income. This has led him to take the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in his basic ingredients (flour, sugar, cinnamon, water, eggs, food colourings, oil, etc.) which will allow him to reach his goal of meeting increased demand to generate improved earnings so that his and his family's quality of life can improve over time.

.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cinnamon, water, eggs, food colourings, oil etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's group includes six hard-working women. Judith is 21 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Judith has been working hard to manage her small business, laying bricks. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to make and lay bricks, and it will help Judith to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Judith hopes that, in the future, she will be able to purchase a motorcycle to help transport materials for her business and to help her family get around town. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make and lay bricks.

loans.name: Carmen Miranda

texts.es: Carmen Miranda de 64 años de edad, vive sola en su propia casa. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos de aluminio. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado a las afueras del Mercado Central de la zona donde ella habita la cual es una zona muy transitada en especial el puesto de Carmen ya que cuando de productos de aluminio se trata ella posee los mejores y los más económicos.  Tiene muchos años de trabajar en este negocio y a pesara de su avanzada edad todavía no se rinde, tiene muchas energías y  fuerzas para seguir trabajando. De acuerdo a su experiencia sabe que en esta temporada las ventas tienden a aumentar por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar de mas productos de aluminio como ollas, cacerolas, peroles, etc. Espera  que de esta forma su calidad de vida vaya cambiando.
texts.en: Carmen Miranda is 64 years old and lives alone in her own home. She works selling a verity of aluminum products. Her business is located on the outskirts of the Central Market, in the area where she lives. It is a very well traveled area, especially Carmen's spot because when it comes to aluminum products she has the best and the least expensive. She has spent many years working in this business and despite her advanced age she does not give up, she has a lot of energy and strength to continue working. In accordance with her experience she knows that in these times her sales need to increase. For this reason she made the decision to seek this credit from Integral to invest in the purchase of more aluminum products like pots and pans, etc. She hopes that in this manner her quality of life will change.

loans.use: To buy various aluminum products.

loans.name: Cicila

texts.en: Cicila is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, none of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for three years. Cicila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rabikhon

texts.ru: Рабихон жительница города Исфара. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Рабихон занимается торговлей на рынке. Она готовит и продает горохи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки гороха в оптом.
texts.en: Rabikhon lives in the city of Isfara. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Rabikhon trades in the market. She cooks and sells peas. She has been doing this for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy peas in bulk.

loans.use: buy peas in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soap.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 27, is single and lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and food.

For the past year, he has operated a boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) business. His major business challenge is transportation because of poor infrastructure which makes transportation difficult during rainy season. He dreams of expanding his business to meet customer demand in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, Daniel wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 11, all of whom go to school. 

Scovia runs a food store, and she has been in the business for two years. She has no employees. Scovia heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and through outreach and promotion undertaken by the loan officers. She is requesting a loan of SDG 2500 to purchase more items like sweet potatoes, fresh maize, brooms, and others. Other than this business, Scovia has no other sources of income.

In five years' time, Scovia would like to expand her business and have a good store. Her major challenge is competition in the market from similar food stores, which contributes to her low income.

Scovia says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially its assistance to women, by providing capital to start up small-scale businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Daru

texts.en:
Daru is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.  She operates a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan and has been in business for three years.

Daru is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax print and embroidered fabric.

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: Virginia del Carmen de 66 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su sobrino el cual está bajo su cuidado. Virginia se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable pero sobre todo carismática. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado mantener activo un comedor, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el mismo. Gracias a su carisma se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Virginia trabaja muy duro para poder sacar a delante a su sobrino dado que es la única que colabora con la economía del hogar. Su sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su sobrino por lo que se esfuerza para que su negocio siga funcionando de la mejor manera posible. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el comedor en la compra de los insumos necesarios (verduras, carnes, frutas, frijoles, arroz, gas propano, etc.) para preparar los ricos platillos que día a día ofrece a los clientes, todo esto lo hace con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos y por consecuencia poder lograr su sueño de dar a su sobrino una mejor realidad.
texts.en: Virginia del Carmen is 66 years old and lives in her own home together with her nephew who is under her care. Virginia is characterized as being entrepreneurial, responsible but above all, charismatic. With a lot of dedication, she has managed to actively run a restaurant, which is her primary source of income. She has spent many years working on this business, so that now she is very experienced. Thanks to her charisma, she has gained the respect of many people in the area so that she already has several loyal customers. Virginia works very hard to be able to allow her nephew to get ahead since he is the only one that assists with the economy of their home. Her dream is to better her quality of life and that of her nephew, therefore she strives to keep her business functioning in the best way possible. She made the decision to seek this loan from Integral to invest it in the restaurant to buy the necessary inputs (vegetables, fruit, beans, rice, propane gas, etc.) to prepare the rich meals that each day she offers to her customers. All of this she does with the goal of increasing her demand which will permit her to increase her level of sales and income and consequently she will be able to realize her dream of giving her nephew a better life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, fruit, beans, rice, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes and damask

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals, drinks, candies, detergent, sweet bread, paper, etc.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is 38 years old.  He is single and lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, he has operated a business in the jua kali sector (metal and woodworking sector), welding and selling to garage operators. The primary challenge he faces in his business is seasonality. His dream is to expand and become self reliant in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he plans to purchase a welding machine for his business. He decided to join Yehu in order to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy potatoes and watermelons

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 40 years old and married with four children, all of whom attend school.  She operates a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan and has been in business for three years.

Ludy is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is 29 years old.  He is a single man and lives at a rental house that has running water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

With the loan of 20,000 KES he plans to open a vegetable stall and begin a produce selling business by purchasing sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.  The two main challenges he faces in this business are the high cost of transportation and seasonality. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru: Мунаввархон занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Munavvarhon works in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock for resale.  She has been doing this for six years. She is taking out a loan to buy sheep or goats.

loans.use: buy sheep or goats.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is 39 years old and married with four children ranging in age from 12 to 22.  She is a self-motivated woman.  For the past 13 years, she has sold clothing.  In addition, she does farming work to supplement her income.  Her primary business challenge is the high cost charged when importing the clothes.  She will use the loan of 40,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.  Monicah hopes and dreams to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is engaged in agriculture. Edgar would like to develop beekeeping, for which he needs some financial investments. With the loan's help Edgar will get more honey from beehives. He can then sell the honey and get additional income. The latter is vital for Edgar and his family. Edgar lives with his wife and children in a very small flat. As the children are growing up, it is becoming necessary to expand the house. This loan will help Edgar to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssata a environ 46 ans et est mère de six. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye extension, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)..
Madame Aïssata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des savons de beauté et divers articles depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité de façon ambulante avec une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes dans la ville de Sikasso . Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché.
Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.    
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elle compte acheter 10 cartons de savons de beauté, 6 cartons de jus de fruit de qualités différents. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Aïssata is about 46 years old and a mother of six.  She lives with only her husband and their children in Hamdallaye Extension, one of the neighborhoods at the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Over 20 years ago, after running several businesses unsuccessfully, Aïssata launched this business buying and selling beauty soaps and other various items.  She is a travelling vendor and her customer base consists of women in the city of Sikasso.  Now she wants to take advantage of this current loan from Soro Yiriwaso to become a large-scale saleswoman with a stall in the market.
She is on her second individual loan; the previous loan was fully paid back.
With this second loan she plans on buying 10 boxes of beauty soaps and 6 boxes of fruit juice of many different varieties.  She gets her supplies in Bamako.
She plans to use this loan to generate a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs.  These profits will allow her to pay off most of her own expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the remaining funds into her business.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps and fruit juice

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 30-year-old married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Luzminda has a pigpen, and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requests a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Luzminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like cabbages, eggs, oranges, carrots and many others for her food store.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Âgée de 47 ans, Awa est veuve qui est mère de 2 enfants résidant avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Awa n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école,  s’est initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente de poissons frais et d’oignons en provenance de Dakar (République du Sénégal). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Elle est actuellement à son huitième prêt  individuel dont les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce huitième prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 40 cartons de poissons frais et 20 sacs d’Oignons avant de les revendre en détail et en gros aux commerçantes de Sikasso.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 290 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Awa is a 47-year-old widow and mother of two, living with her children in the house that belonged to her now deceased husband in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Since Awa didn’t have the chance to progress far in school, she started this business over ten years ago, selling fresh fish and onions from Dakar (Republic of Senegal).
About four years ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in the hope of better satisfying her growing customer base.  She is currently on her eighth individual loan cycle; all of her previous loans have been fully paid back.
This eighth loan will enable her to purchase 40 boxes of fresh fish and 20 bags of onions for retail sale and wholesale to the vendors in Sikasso.
She plans on using this loan to general a monthly profit of 290,000 CFA francs, which will mainly be used to increase her business capital, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and onions

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Delia has a pigpen, and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of four hard working women. Florence is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food items for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and cover her family's medical expenses. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase land and build a house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for resale,

loans.name: Fatoumata Modibo

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Modibo a  environ 46 ans et  est mère de cinq enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Madame Fatoumata Modibo après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et vente d’habits, de produits de beauté et divers depuis plus de sept ans. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso . Maintenant, elle veut profiter de ce prêt de Soro Yiriwaso pour devenir une grande commerçante au niveau du marché où elle opère afin de satisfaire sa clientèle dont la plupart sont des femmes.
Elle  est à son cinquième prêt individuel. Les prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.    
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 8 complets de tissus brodé, 8 cartons de pommade de qualités différentes, 10 sacs à main pour les femmes, 5 cartons de parfum de qualités différentes, 5 cartons de dédorant, 5 cartons de savon de beauté, 10 paires de chaussures et des trousseaux des nouveaux nés. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (république du Burkina Faso) et souvent à Lomé (république du Togo). 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA. Ces bénéfices réalisés lui permettront de contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Modibo is about 46 years old and a mother of five.  She lives with her husband and their children in Wayerma I, one of the neighborhoods at the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Over seven years ago, after running several businesses unsuccessfully, Fatoumata Modibo started this business buying and selling clothes, beauty products and other various items.  She runs her business out of the large market in Sikasso.  Now, she wants to take advantage of this loan from Soro Yiriwaso to become a large-scale saleswoman in the market she works in, in order, ultimately, to better satisfy her customers, most of whom are women.
She is on her fifth individual loan cycle.  All her previous loans were fully paid back.
With this loan, she plans on buying 8 outfits of embroidered fabric, 8 boxes of various sorts of ointments, 10 womens’ handbags, 5 boxes of various types of perfume, 5 boxes of deodorant, 5 boxes of beauty soap, 10 pairs of shoes and newborn outfits.  She gets her supplies in Bamako, Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso), and often in Lomé (Republic of Togo).
She plans on using this loan to generate monthly profits of 275,000 CFA francs.  These profits will enable her to contribute the family expenses, pay interest on her loan, and invest the remaining funds into her business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 35-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.
Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Agée de 47 ans, Madame Fatoumata est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, résidant avec ses enfants et son époux à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de vingt ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente des légumes (Choux pomme, Gombo, poivrons, tomates, d’aubergine etc). Elle achète les légumes dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de Choux-pommes, 10 sacs de Gombo, 5 sacs d’Aubergine 10 sacs de Tomates et 3 sacs de Poivrons avant de les revendre en détail et en gros au marché de Hamdallaye dont elle dispose une place.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a 47-year-old married mother of five, living with her children and her husband in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Over 20 years ago, not having had the chance to progress far in school, she started working buying and selling vegetables (cabbage, okra, peppers, tomatoes, eggplant, etc.).  She purchases her vegetables in the towns around Sikasso.
About two years ago, hoping to better satisfy her customers, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution.  She is on her fourth individual loan cycle; all her previous loans have been fully paid back.
This fourth loan will enable her to purchase 10 bags of cabbage, 10 bags of okra, 5 bags of eggplant, 10 bags of tomatoes and 3 bags of peppers before selling them retail and wholesale in the Hamdallaye market, where she has a stand.
She plans on using this loan to generate a monthly profit of 190,000 CFA francs, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and invest any remaining funds into her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Fayziddin

texts.ru: Файзиддин занимается торговлей тканей у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности он занимается год. Ему 21 год. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он берет кредит для покупки разноцветный тканей.
texts.en: Fayziddin sells fabric out of his home. He has been doing this for a year. He is 21 years old, married, and has one child. He is taking out a loan to buy colorful fabric.

loans.use: to buy colorful fabric.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna a 52 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses quatre enfants à Wayerma II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des légumes et de tubercules tels les ignames, il y a maintenant quinze  ans. Elle mène son activité de façon ambulante et à son domicile conjugal à une  clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de continuer à collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à  son premier prêt individuel, après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 20 sacs d’igname. Elle achète en gros sur place aux agriculteurs venant à la foire  avant de les revendre en détail aux étrangers et aux forains de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is 52 years old and lives in an extended family with her husband and her four children in Wayerma II, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Fifteen years ago, not having had the chance to progress far in school, she started this business buying and selling vegetables and root vegetables like yams.  She sells her vegetables on foot as well as from her home to a customer base that includes both men and women.  She has decided to continue her collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in the hopes of better satisfying her customers.  She is on her first individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso, after four group loans with a women’s association from her neighborhood, all of which were fully paid back.
With this new loan she plans on buying 20 bags of yams.  She buys wholesale on-site with farmers attending the market, and then sells retail to foreigners and stallkeepers in the city.  
She plans on using this loan to generate monthly profits of 100,000 CFA francs, which will go largely towards contributing to the family’s expenses and paying interest on her loan, with any remaining funds being re-invested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase yams

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo, a married 58-year-old resident of the Philippines, has operated a pigpen that sells grown pigs for the past 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed for the pigs. In the future, Ricardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka, a 42-year-old single mother of two children, both of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwaka has operated a palm wine business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who take goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase coconuts for making more palm wine to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for making palm wine to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie 26, is a single woman with one child who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business,  Her potential customer are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other beauty salon operators. Her major challenge is to hire more employees in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase a blow dryer, weaves and cosmetics. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer, weaves and cosmetics.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Salimata a 27 ans, elle réside chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Mademoiselle Salimata n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études, s’est vite initiée à la coiffure féminine depuis environs trois années. Avec une telle expérience dans un domaine, elle est beaucoup sollicitée par des jeunes demoiselles surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, anniversaire, etc.). L’insuffisance des ressources propres  pour bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de cette demande de prêt à Soro Yiriwaso afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de huit mois et est à son premier prêt pour augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de pouvoir acheter 20 paquets de mèches de différentes qualités, 30 boites de gels et une douzaine de vernis de couleurs différentes à Bamako. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier prêt, un bénéfice moyen 90 000 FCFA lui permettant de résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Miss Salimata is 27 years old. She lives in her father’s home in a large traditional extended family in Mancourani II, one of Sikasso’s working-class neighborhoods. Miss Salimata didn’t have the chance to continue her studies and became a hairdresser about three years ago, shortly after leaving school. With such experience in the field, she is much sought after by young ladies, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, anniversaries, etc.). The insufficiency of clean resources to adequately operate this business is the reason and justification for this loan request to Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy ever-growing customer demand.

She has been associated with Soro Yiriwaso for more than eight months. She is on her first loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy 20 packages of hair extensions of varied qualities, 30 boxes of gels and a dozen boxes of different colors of nail polish at Bamako. 

With this second loan, she hopes to earn an average profit of 90,000 FCA, enabling her to cover her essential expenses, contribute to the household expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To buy articles for her hair salon.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Jocelyn is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. She hires someone to drive the bicycle & has an arrangement on how to divide the income. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & gasoline

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata est une femme mariée de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants dans  une grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Salimata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès  s’est initiée à la fabrique de savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a environ six années, qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile conjugal à Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de 3 ans. Après 5 prêts tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 20 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pâtes noires), 10 sacs de soude caustique et 6 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes de sa localité..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Salimata is a married woman of 43 and a mother of four children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Fama, the downtown area of  Sikasso. 
After having unsuccessfully tried many businesses, Salimata learned how to make traditional soaps (black soaps) approximately six years ago, from a neighbor. She runs her business out of her family home in Sikasso where her products are highly sought after by her clients for their quality. 
To satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After successfully reimbursing 5 loans, she is applying for her 6th individual loan. 
With this loan, she will purchase 20 barrels of cottonseed oil (used oil), 10 bags of soda ash and 6 wheelbarrows full of firewood. After making soap from used cottonseed oil and soda ash, she sells them retail to a clientele of mostly local women.
With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly income of 275 000 XOF, which will be used mainly to grow her business capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase used cottonseed oil and soda ash

loans.name: Zilda

texts.en:
Zilda, 40, is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable stall business selling at wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Grace has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries & cookies. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for the bakeshop

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 38 years old and married with five children. Four of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en: For the past 10 years Benedicto, a 50-year married father of three who lives in the Philippines, has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Benedicto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children.  Josephine has a barbecue shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue.  Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Virginia has a barbecue shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 10 years.

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue.  Virginia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virginia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue

loans.name: Benedetta

texts.en:
Benedetta, 56, is a divorced mother of four children, all of whom graduated from school.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past 14 years, she has owned a school.  Her potential customers are children from the neighboring school. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer needs in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child, who is in college. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child, who is in college.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice 46, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a retail shop business, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has twelve children. 

Isabelo provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for fifteen years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and service.

Isabelo became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Isabelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and service.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Lourdes has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie maintenant et père d'un enfant de 9 ans, n'ayant pas de moyen pour soutenir ses etudes, il se lance dans la vente des fournitures de bureau, des livres , des dictionnaires et de fournitures scolaires.
Il a deja beneficie de plusieurs cycle de prets, il a un fort capital, il a la capacite de s'approvisionner en fournitures de tous genres et il a fait des epargnes considerables.

Tres ambitieux, il a pour ambition d'ouvrir une papeterie et il s'occupe valablement de sa famille et assure la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
This client is a 41 years old.  He is now married and has a 9 year old child.  Without a way to pay for education, he has begun to sell office supplies, books, dictionaries, and school supplies.   
He has already taken out several loans.  He has significant capital.  He has the ability to stock up on supplies of all kinds and is saving considerable amounts of money.  

He is very ambitious and hopes to open a stationary store, take care of his family, and ensure the education of his child.

loans.use: to purchase notepads, bags, books, sets of ballpoint pens and pencils, and other supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 32, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a pharmacy shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 (Kenya shillings) she wants to purchase medicines to sell at the pharmacy. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to sell at the pharmacy.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is a 35-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Nema is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans, onions, and tomatoes. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, onions, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Evelyn has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Agripa

texts.en:
Agripa is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Agripa has a poultry farm that sells grown & matured chickens She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy animal feed for the chickens.

Agripa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agripa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, 31, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a food stall for the past seven years, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Emma has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy beauty products from Natasha and Avon. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Sarah has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Sarah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passers-by. She dreams of establishing a stall for selling clothes in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chiru

texts.en:
Chiru is a divorced woman with five children. One of her children attends school, and the others have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fess.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling maize from home to her neighbours and passers-by. In addition she also owns rental houses, which serve as another source of income. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase iron sheets and cement to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets and cement to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 18 ans et 23 ans, il commence avec la papeterie en 1986, il achète des cartons de cahiers de différents qualités, des rames de papiers, des stylos, crayons et des livres.
Il a toujours fait ses remboursements a temps, et très régulier dans les épargnes, il a un puissant capital.
Pour le nouveau prêt, il va acheter dix cartons de rames de papiers, 10 cartons de cahiers, des cartons de stylos de différents couleurs, des crayons de couleurs et tous les  fournitures utiles, les registres pour les bureaux et les enfants qui sont sur les bancs d’écoles.
Pour sa famille, il est entrain de se battre pour construire sa maison et s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et il est entrain de penser a élargir son étalage.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old.  He is a married father of 4 children who range in age from 18 to 23, he started a stationary store in 1986. He purchases boxes of notebooks of varied quality, reams of paper, pens, pencils, and books.
He has always reimbursed his loans on time and regularly puts money into savings and has a large working capital.
With this new loan, he will purchase ten boxes of reams of paper, 10 boxes of notebooks, boxes of pens of different colors, colored pencils, and all necessary supplies, business and school registers.
For his family, he is trying hard to build a house and provide for the education of his children.  He is thinking about expanding his stall.

loans.use: to purchase reams of paper, boxes of pens, pencils, registers, and notebooks

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is 35 years old and married with four children. For the past five years Rolyn has had a sari-sari store (a food shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rolyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Rolyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 year old and a married woman with two children not yet in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for the past three years.

Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase additional charcoal. She will save her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and is married with three children. For the past ten years she has had a sari-sari store (a food shop) where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. She is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Corazon hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 41 years old and married with two children. For the past eight years she has had a shop where she sells green bananas and coconuts for copra.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell.

Grace hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira, thirty, is a single woman who lives in a rental that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past four years, Samira has operated a tailor shop, selling her wares from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenge of competition from other tailor shops in the area.

Samira decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ future needs.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret, 33, is a single woman who lives in a rental that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years Margret has sold clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other clothes vendors in the area.

Margret decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With her loan of 10,000 KES she wants to purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

Margaret dreams of establishing a clothes stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 33 year old gentleman who is married and has two children. He has been a farmer for the past ten years.

He has applied for his second loan with KADET Ltd. to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers and to buy more farm animals. He has been a good client who hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer and to buy more farm animals.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.

Maricar has a vegetable garden and she sells vegetables such as patola, ampalaya, and string-beans every harvest time. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,200 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden. 

Maricar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maricar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Tambudzai

texts.en:
Tambudzai is  a 34 years old married woman, and has three children, aged 3, 8, and 14 and also takes care of her young sister. Two of her children are going to school. 
Tambudzai does a variety of business activities including selling clothes, peanuts, and meat products. She has been in business for seven years and has three employees, including one of her sons who does administrative work. She buys some of her products from Harare and  Masvingo local wholesalers.Tambudzai says one of the challenges she faces is transport since she uses public transport. She has requested for a loan of $1 000 to buy some wares for resale. With the extra money generated from this loan, she will be able to upgrade her standard of living and pay school fees for her children on time.In the next five years Tambudzai would like to own her own butchery and a truck to transport her products from the suppliers to her shops.

loans.use: to buy clothes, peanuts, chicken cuts, and sausages.

loans.name: Dilsa

texts.es:
Dilsa  de 44 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Malambo, con su cónyuge e hijo de 9 años de edad y allí mismo tiene una miscelánea,  donde vende accesorios femeninos, papelería, artículos de belleza entre otras mercancías,  de acuerdo con la exigencia de la temporada.  Su experiencia emprendedora comenzó desde hace 15 años, cuando aplicando su creatividad inició su negocio, elaborando con sus propias manos productos artesanales y aprovechando que su cónyuge era vendedor de un almacén, donde  hizo contactos comerciales en las instalaciones de pequeñas colmenas a su alrededor y  construyó su propia clientela y finalmente, hace menos de 2 años,  cuando este dejó de trabajar en el almacén, invirtieron su liquidación en una miscelánea agregando a sus productos, mercancías variadas, inicialmente sobre los pedidos y posteriormente en el marco de la época en la cual se mueve cada producto.
Como  la creatividad de Dilsa no tiene límites, así como su deseo de aprender,  además de fabricar productos en pequeños materiales de cuero, también aprendió últimamente a elaborar sandalias, que ahora exhibe en su miscelánea con mucho orgullo. Su negocio gradualmente va creciendo, porque su clientela se ha expandido, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará juguetería, aprovechando la temporada de navidad, que usualmente llega con muchos pedidos de sus clientes especialmente de juguetes, para el nacimiento del niño Dios, los niños lo reciban llenos de alegría y jugando por las calles de su municipio.
texts.en:
Dilsa is 44 years old. She lives in the town of Malambo with her husband and 9 year old son. She has a variety store in her house, where she sells women's accessories, paper products, beauty items and other merchandise, according to the season. Her enterprising experience began 15 years ago, when, using her creativity, she started her business. She made artisanal crafts with her own hands, taking advantage of the fact that her spouse worked in a store. He made commercial contacts in the small communities nearby and built their own clientele. Finally, less than 2 years ago, when her husband stopped working in the store, they invested his severance package in a variety store. They mixed their own products and various merchandise. They started selling via orders and later sold according to each season. 

Dilsa's creativity knows no limits, nor does her desire to learn. Besides making products out of materials such as leather, she also learned to make sandals, which she displays in her store with much pride. Her business is growing gradually, because her clientele has expanded. This is the reason why she has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy toys, taking advantage of the Christmas season. Usually she has a lot of orders from her customers, especially for toys, given to children for the birth of the Christ child. They receive them with much joy and they play in the streets of town.

loans.use: to buy toys

loans.name: Procina

texts.en:
Procina is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Procina has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and trout. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fish to sell.

Procina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Procina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 46, married, and has two children who both attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years, Nelly has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Her major dream is to expand her business to meet her customer needs.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Nelly wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 36 years old and has two children who are four and eight years old. Both children are in school. She owns a restaurant, which she has been running for five years. Brigitte would like a loan to buy rice, potatoes, bananas, and other foodstuffs to use in her restaurant. Any profits from the business will be used to buy a house. In the future, she would like to run a bar.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Tseko

texts.en:
Tseko, 49, is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a hawking business, moving from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diovelyn

texts.en:
Diovelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Diovelyn has a food shop or sari-sari store where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She is using their motorcycle to buy stock from bigger stores as her husband is the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Diovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Diovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 24 years old and single. For the past five years he has operated a barbershop.

Robert has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy materials and equipment needed for his barbershop.

Robert hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment needed for his barbershop.

loans.name: Newlife Group

texts.en:
This is sixty-year-old Keresencia from Masvingo, a town in southeastern Zimbabwe. She is widowed with four children and cares for twelve dependents as well. 

For the past twenty years Keresencia has sold vegetables to earn a living. She says the main challenge she faces is the high cost of produce. 

Keresencia has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy vegetables for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to take care of her orphaned grandchildren. 

In the future Keresencia plans to build a refrigerated store room for storing her vegetables.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, apples, cabbages and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Zulekha

texts.en:
Zulekha, 42, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past four years Zulekha has sold juice to earn a living, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is one of seasonality in her business.

Zulekha decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a loan of 20,000 KES she wants to realize her dream of establishing another eatery. For this she needs to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and rice so as to open a new eatery.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
Rey is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Rey has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rey hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para seguir cultivando en el terreno, este será invertido en la compra de insumos como el abono y herbicidas, también en la preparación del terreno, los préstamos han tenido un efecto positivo en Edilberto, ayudándole a mejorar las cosechas.
texts.en:
Ediberto decided on a new loan in order to continue cultivating the land.  The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies like fertilizer and herbicides.  The loan will also be used in the preparation of the land.

The loans have had a positive effect on Edilberto as they are helping him to improve his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 
Girlie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Girlie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Girlie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de ropa, ya que ella necesita comprar más mercadería, el cual le ayudado a mantener a su familia y comprar: short, camisas, pantalones, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, carteras, cinchos, para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
Ella se siente feliz porque con los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar en sus ganancias en el negocio de cosmeticos y el cual le ha permitido a vivir en mejores condiciones de vida con su familia
texts.en:
Karla has decided on a new loan in order to invest in her clothing business.  She needs to buy more merchandise, which has helped her support her family.

She will buy shorts, shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, underwear, wallets, and belts in order to attend to her customers’ demand.

She is happy because the previous loan helped her increase her earnings in her cosmetics business.  That has allowed her to have better living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy shorts, shirts, pants, blouses, skirts, underwear, wallets, and belts.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 48 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has earned a living by offering pedicure and manicure services.

Araceli has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional materials needed for her business.

Araceli hopes to see her pedicure and manicure business grow.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pedicure and manicure business.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah, 35, is a married woman with six children: three boys and three girls. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For the past ten years Serah has sold flowers to earn a living, selling them to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a food stall which contributes to her income. 

Serah decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase seeds to grow flowers for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to grow flowers for sale.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past three years Matilda has operated a café at the market catering to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other café operators in the area.

Matilda decided to join Yehu to access their loans. With a loan of 20,000 KES she will purchase stocks of beans, maize and wheat flour, rice and cooking oil.

Matilda dreams of establishing a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of beans, maize and wheat flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is 33 years old and single. He has one child. For the past five years Ronel has had a shop where he makes and sells candies and pulvoron, a type of shortbread.

Ronel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. He is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients to make his snacks.

Ronel hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients to make his snacks.

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet's Group is comprised of two hardworking young women. One of the women is Harriet, who is eighteen years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells food and home supplies to local customers.

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food to sell in her shop. Greater profits will help Harriet cover her family's medical expenses.

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Harriet's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy enamel ware, including pots and pans, for resale.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, 40, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also owns rental houses, which provide her with another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her rental houses to accommodate more tenants in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cement and colored paint to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and colored paint to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Josefina has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josefina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cinnamon, “chan”(aromatic plant with nutritional and curative properties), and “horchata” (cold drink made from tiger nuts).

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Evangeline has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas to resell.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and pay rent and rates to the Local Authority

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Jane from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with three children. Two of them are attending school. Jane runs a tailoring business. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is the electricity shortage as she sometimes work during the night to cover up for time lost. Jane has requested a loan of $400 to buy material for tailoring. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to feed her family and send them to a better school. In the future, Jane plans to own a bigger factory and employ at least a significant number of employees.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 32 years old, married and has two children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last six years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode and this is his second loan, which he has planned to use to purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the part of the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to a higher level of education. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve, if funded.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 47 years old and has six children aged 8 to 23 years old. All of her children attend school. She sells clothes in a store she has run for six years. Donatha would like a loan to increase her inventory of clothing to sell. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of becoming a clothing distributor in the future.

loans.use: To add more clothes in her store.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 31 years old and has 2 children aged 2 and 5. The eldest child is in school. Her husband is a home builder. She owns a canteen which she has run for 4 years. Claudine would like a loan to buy a refrigerator, fresh dairy, and flasks to use in her canteen. She will use any profits to build a house. She dreams to see her business grow and prosper.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, fresh dairy, and flasks to use in her canteen

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
