Cheryl is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Cheryl has a shop that sells food seasonings & spices. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy food seasonings & spices for sale.
Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings & spices for sale

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 43 years old and has 4 children aged 10 to 18. All 4 children are in school. She owns a general store which she has been running for 3 years. She would like a loan to buy sugar, salt, rice, and other goods to sell in her shop. Dative will use any profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a very hard working woman who is a fruit vendor. She is 35 years old, married and they have three children. 

She is applying for her first loan which she plans to use partly to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and wheat seeds) and partly to use in the fruit vending business expansion. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Dolores Patricia

texts.es:
Dolores, nuevamente se ha decidido a obtener un nuevo préstamo para su negocio ya que quiere comprar más mercadería para ropa, ya que  le ayudado mucho a mantener a su familia por los créditos que adquirido y comprar la mercadería necesaria para tener más variedad como faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Ella se siente contenta por los créditos anteriores y le ha ayudado a mejorar su negocio y sobre todo su familia vive en buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores has decided to take out a loan again for her business. She wants to buy more merchandise, such as clothing. The loans she has had  have really helped her support her family, buying merchandise she needs to have more variety, such as skirts, blouses, pants, shorts and underwear. This helps her attend to her customers' needs.  

Ella se siente contenta por los créditos anteriores y le ha ayudado a mejorar su negocio y sobre todo su familia vive en buenas condiciones de vida.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: Lucie is 36 years old with 3 children aged 6 to 12. She is married to a soldier. She sells clothes in a shop she has run for 1 year. Lucie would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell in her store. Any profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams to run a prosperous store with a variety of clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 42 años vive en un barrio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 5 a 23 años;  allí se dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas especialmente perfumes y ropa en todas las líneas. Para cumplir con sus pedidos en un mercado competido como en el que interactúa, Maribel está aplicando a su Credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domino, con el que comprará ropa,  con la cual sus clientes  estarán muy elegantes en las fiestas  de fin de año.  Su negocio lo inició Maribel, desde hace más de 11 años, ella inicialmente vendía pocas mercancías, pero gradualmente agregó nuevos  productos, así como y proveedores a través de los cuales adquirió a través del código de su hermana,  guías o catálogos con los cuales promociona su venta a  clientes, que son principalmente trabajadores de empresas y vecinos del sector donde habita con su familia. En la actualidad está muy cerca la temporada de mayor movimiento comercial, en la cual  las ventas se incrementan y requiere  tener mucho inventario y responder a pedidos de sus clientes  en mayor volumen que el usual. Esta es la razón por la cual proyecta que la inversión de su credikiva sería exitosa y ella ganaría un poco más, rotaria rápidamente su mercancía y respondería a sus expectativas de crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 42, lives in a neighborhood located in the south of the city with her husband and 4 children, ages 5 to 23. There, she is engaged in the sale of varied merchandise, especially perfumes and clothing in all styles. In order to fill her orders in the competitive market in which she participates, Maribel is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first financing she has sought from Fundación Mario Santo Domino. With it she will buy clothing in which her customers will be very elegant at the year-end parties.

Maribel began her business more than 11 years ago. Initially she sold few items, but gradually she added new products. In addition, she was able to get new suppliers who, thanks to her sister’s representative account number, provided her with guides or catalogues which she could use to promote sales to customers. Her customers are primarily workers in businesses and neighbors in the area where she lives with her family.

Currently, it is very close to the season of great commercial activity during which sales increase and require a lot of inventory to respond to orders from her customers, which are at a greater volume than usual. This is the reason why her plans for investment of the loan would be successfully for she would earn a little more from the rapid turnover of inventory and would respond to the expectations of increasing business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 37 years old and is married. She sells clothes in a shop she has run for 8 years. She would like a loan to increase her inventory of clothes. Beatrice will use any profits to build a house. She dreams to have a prosperous store with a variety of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Chryzl

texts.en:
Chryzl is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 
Chryzl has a pigpen that sells grown & mature pigs. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Chryzl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Chryzl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children. 
Reynaldo has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Reynaldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jinnefer

texts.en:
Jinnefer is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jinnefer is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the motorcycle.
Jinnefer has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jinnefer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase firewood, oil and corn.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Caren, a 26-year-old  single mother of one child, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has had a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Caren hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha is taking another Kiva loan to boost her poultry business. Her previous loan helped improved her profits and helped her meet customer demand. With the Kshs 10,000 loan she is now requesting, Furaha wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed for her business.  She dreams of expanding her enterprise in the future and employing more people.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Jorena

texts.en: Jorena, a 39-year-old married mother of seven children, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells soaps, detergents and shampoo for the past five years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more soaps, detergents and shampoo. In the future, Jorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents & shampoo.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 35 years old and married with three children. She is  a very hardworking woman who has practiced mixed farming for over five years. Rebecca also runs a salon. 

Rebecca is applying for her first loan to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and wheat seeds, and to expand her salon business. She intends to use the additional income generated with her loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she hopes to develop her businesses and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and expand her salon business

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is 40 years old and has an 8-year-old child. For the past nine years, she has sold palm oil in her shop. 

Shadia is requesting a loan to increase her palm oil inventory. She will use the profits from her loan to renovate her house. In the future, Sadia dreams of running a big and prosperous shop.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no running water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, and rent bills. For the past six years, Lucy has operated a fish-selling business, selling wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the seasonality of her place of operation. Lucy decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Lucy is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of fish to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer needs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Assoumpta

texts.en:
Assoumpta is 26 years old and has a two-year-old child. For the past three years, she has sold bed sheets in a shop. 

Assoumpta is requesting a loan to buy more bed sheets to sell. She will use any profits from her loan to provide for her family. Assoumpta hopes to one day expand her store to sell clothes as well as bed sheets.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: Tatiana Lizbeth

texts.es:
Tatiana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, ya que quiere comprar más mercadería  de perfumes para damas y caballeros, ya que este negocio en la sala de belleza y tienda, le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia y  a tener más variedad para atender la demanda de los clientes.

Ella está contenta porque los préstamos anteriores le han permitido crecer y mejorar la clientela, y cada día darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Tatiana has decided to get a new loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy more perfumes for men and women. Selling these in the beauty parlor and shop has helped her keep her family and have a more varied stock to satisfy her clients' demands.
She is pleased because previous loans have allowed her to grow and increase her clientele, as well as to provide the best for her family every day.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for men and women.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and married with four children aged 3 to 14. The three eldest children are in school. She sells beans and sorghum in a shop she has run for three years. 

Beatrice would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. Any profits will be used to buy a hectare of land. She dreams of having a large inventory of foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 35 years old and is married with five children aged 4 to 14. The four eldest children are in school. She sells foodstuffs in a shop she has run for four years. She would like a loan to buy bananas, sorghum, and potatoes. Any profits will be used to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of becoming a distributor of foodstuffs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sorghum and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Helen has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 32 years old and is single. She owns a canteen which she has run for three years. She would like a loan to buy fresh dairy, sugar, flasks, tables, and chairs in order to upgrade her canteen. Delphine will use any profits to start building a house. She would like to own a farm some day in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fresh dairy, sugar and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Kolokunye

texts.en:
Kolokunye is a married woman and a mother to five children who solely depend on her. She has been farming for a period of six years and gets enough income to take care of her family.

She learned about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds, fertilizers and to hire manpower to aid her in the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds.

loans.name: Colete

texts.en: Colete is 22 years old with two children aged 6 months and 4 years. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver. She owns a general store, which she has run for 1 year. Colete would like a loan to buy sugar, salt, soap, and other goods to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to provide for her family. She dreams of running a big and prosperous store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old and married with four children aged 6 to 15. All of the children are currently in school. She works as a tailor and sells clothes in a store she has run for 17 years. Beatrice would like a loan to buy fabric, thread, and needles to make more clothing. Any profits will be used to pay the school fees for her children. She dreams of running a big sewing workshop where she can employ other women.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años.
Paulina tiene un negocio de Panadería, ella lo que mas aprendió de las capacitaciones es a valorarse como mujer eso le ayuda a poder progresar porque confía en ella misma para lograr sus proyectos, le gustan las capacitaciones, recuerda que cuando su hija se enfermó la ayudaron y ella valora mucho eso. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquinas para la panadería.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is 39 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She has also been a member of FINCA Perú for the last 4 years.
Paulina runs a bakery. What she learned most during training workshops was to value herself as a woman; this has helped her progress because she now has enough confidence in herself to know that she will be able to achieve her projects. She likes training workshops. She can remember that she was given aid when her daughter got sick and she values that a lot. She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying machinery for her bakery.

loans.use: to buy machinery for her bakery

loans.name: Cartas

texts.en: Cartas is 57 years old and has four children aged 5 to 20. All of her children are in school. She sells foodstuffs in a shop she has run for 14 years. Cartas would like a loan to buy beans and sorghum to sell in her shop. Any profits will be used to build a house for her family. She hopes to have a big inventory to sell in her shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bruna

texts.en:
Bruna is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

For 20 years, Bruna has run a shop where she makes and sells snacks like rice and pancakes that are known locally as torta. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making her snacks.

Bruna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Bruna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

For two years, Rubelyn has run a construction shop where she makes and sells hollow blocks [cinder blocks]. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy the materials needed to make hollow blocks.

Rubelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for making hollow blocks.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, 39, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are on food and clothing.

For the past six years, she has operated a hawking business, selling to passers-by and neighbors nearby the road. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in the market. She dreams of expanding to establish another business in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes, shoes and belts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes, shoes and belts for sale

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica  la venta de pupusas, el negocio lo inicio hace seis años el cual lo apredio de su madre vende solo los sábado y domingo por las tardes.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar la materia prima como: quesillo, chicharrón, repollo, tomates, de esa forma tendrá lo necesario para poder obtener más ingresos.
El objetivo de milagro es cubrir las necesidades de su familia y aumentar en sus ganancias y de esa manera podrá vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Milagro lives with her husband and two children. She sells pupusas (a stuffed thick corn tortilla). She began the business, which she learned from her mother, 6 years ago. She only makes sales Saturday and Sunday afternoons.  

She needs the loan to buy ingredients like cheese, pork, cabbage, and tomatoes. In this way she will have what she needs to get more profits. 

Milagro’s goal is to afford the family’s necessities and increase her profits. In this way she can live better.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork, cabbage, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ariston

texts.en:
Ariston is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Ariston has a shop that sells fish like sardines and trout. She has had this business for 12 years. She is requesting a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Ariston has been a member of HSPFI since 2008, and hopes to improve her business with help from this loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, 42, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry keeping business, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other poultry operators in the area. Martha dreams of starting another business of motorcycle in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and medicine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and medicine

loans.name: Gorret's Group

texts.en:
Gorret's group is comprises six hard-working women. Gorret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, She has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items to sell in her shop, and will help Gorret generate greater profits and pay her sister's school fees. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Gorret's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Vanessa Liz

texts.es:
Vanessa es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo, tiene 29 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace un año.
Vanessa tiene una bodega, antes se dedicaba a la venta de utensilios, le invitaron a pertenecer a FINCA y desde esa fecha ella pudo tener su propio negocio, siente que ha progresado, y se siente satisfecha con todo lo que pudo lograr, aprendió a tener una buena relación familiar, El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leche, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a member of the communal bank Triunfo. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children. She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for one year. 

Vanessa has a grocery store. Previously she was selling utensils. They invited her to join FINCA and since then she has been able to have her own business. She feels that she’s made progress, and she’s satisfied with all that she’s been able to achieve. She’s learned to have a good family relationship. She will invest the loan she asks for into the purchase of milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy television sets, home theaters, decoder dishes and blankets for resale

loans.name: Kuseyo

texts.en:
Kuseyo is 43 years old and married with six children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 16 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his first loan and he has plans to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals with the loan and also buy animals like cows and goats for raising. He intends to use the returns from the loan to reinvest into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a well-known farmer in the area and provide higher level of education to his kids. He is a hard-working man who struggles to achieve his goals and says he only needs funding to attain more goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals

loans.name: Yesenia Beatriz

texts.es:
Yesenia, vive con sus hijas, su madre, todos en la misma vivienda, ella 10 comerciantes de frutas tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, este puesto de venta no tiene instalado en una zona de comercio, sus hijas le apoyan para atender a los clientes.
Ella solicitó un préstamo para la compra de frutas frescas como manzanas, uvas, peras, bananas, entre otras que son muy necesarias y que los clientes la demanda a diario, esta inversión ayudará primeramente tener experiencia en el manejo de los préstamos y con su negocio fortalecido.
Sus sueños es ser una comerciante con un amplio negocio en diversas frutas, atendiendo a la clientela de una forma eficiente y proveyendo para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Yesenia lives with her daughters and her mother in the same home. She sells fruit and has more than ten years of experience. This trading post is not in a commercial zone. Her daughters help her serve her customers.  

She has asked for a loan to buy fresh fruit like apples, grapes, pears, bananas, etc that are needed and that her customers ask for every day. This investment will primarily help her get experience in how loans work and with strengthening her business. 

Her dream is to be a merchant with a large business with various fruit, serving her customers efficiently and providing her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy applies, grapes, pears, and bananas.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: El señor Cirilo trabaja como ayudante de albañil y es además rentista jubilado. El crédito que solicita es para completar el dinero necesario para poder comprar un terreno, amurallarlo y poner puertas y alquilar como parqueo para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Cirilo es casado y no tiene dependientes. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta es la cuarta vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Cirilo works as a masonry assistant, but he is also a retired pensioner. The loan he is requesting will be used to complete the necessary sum that he needs to buy a piece of land. He will also install fencing and gates so that he can rent out this land as a parking lot, which will help to improve his income. Cirilo is married and has no dependents. He lives in his own home in the District of Villa Dolores in the city of El Alto.

This is the fourth time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land that can be rented out as a parking lot.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
María, vive con esposo tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sopas instantáneas  este negocio lo empezó hace diez años junto a su esposo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar productos de la canasta básica como: frijoles, azúcar, aceite, de esa manera podrá mejorar sus ventas y tener más variedad para esta época de diciembre y obtener más ingresos.
La aspiración de María es crecer su negocio y más ganancias y lo mejor que ella y su esposo vivan mejor.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband. She has a store with staples like rice, beans, sugar, oil, and instant soup. She started this business 10 years ago with her husband. 

She will use the loan to buy basic pantry products like beans, sugar, and oil. In this way she will be able to improve her sales and have more variety in December and get more profits. 

María’s goal is to grow her business and profits so that she and her husband can live better.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Rubin

texts.en:
Rubin is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has three children. Rubin has a shop that sells coconuts for copra. He has had this business for five years. He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy coconuts for sale.

Rubin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and hopes to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Elizabeth has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and works six days a week. She sells her products at the market by means of retail. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and running a small restaurant. 

The main business challenges for Elizabeth include seasonality, transportation and theft. She aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. Elizabeth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina se dedica al comercio de camas y frazadas al por menor. El crédito que solicita es para compra de más camas y frazadas en distintos tamaños, colores y así aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Guillermina es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa en anticretico ubicada en la zona  23 de Marzo  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Guillermina se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos  otorgados (que son cuatro, todos pagados en su totalidad) ya que le ayudo a mejorar  su calidad de vida. Es la segunda vez que desea trabajar con kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina sells beds and blankets at retail. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beds and blankets in different sizes and colors so that she can take advantage of year-end sales. Guillermina is single and has one child. She lives in a rented home in the March 23rd District in the city of El Alto.

Guillermina is very pleased with the loans she has received (four in total, all of which have been paid in full) because they have helped to improve her quality of life. This is the second time she has wanted to work with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beds and blankets to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated has two children. Arlene has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more stock from NATASHA and AVON.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2010, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Abdala is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages 2 and 16, and two of them go to school. 

Abdala runs a utensils store business and has been in the business for 10 years. He has one employee. Abdala heard about Finance Sudan from the word of mouth promotion by the loan officers in the market. He is asking a loan of SDG 1,000 to purchase items like glasses, flasks, spoons, etc. This business is his primary source of income. His major challenges include low income rate and high standard of living in Juba.

In next five years, Abdala hopes to build his own house. Abdala says he appreciates that Finance Sudan is considering men too for the loans as some of the MFIs consider women only.

loans.use: to purchase utensils like glasses, flask, spoons and items

loans.name: Delfina Elisa

texts.es:
Delfina, vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia ella en su casa tiene una tienda y vende comida rápida, todos los días de la semana.
El crédito lo ocupara para fortalecer más su negocio y comprar productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, sopas instantáneas, condimentosy bebidas, para poder obtener mejores ingresos y aumentar sus ventas en este mes de diciembre.
El sueño de delfina que su negocio siempre este más estable y obtener mejores ingresos para que ella y su familia vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Delfina lives with her two children in their own home. She has a store in her house and she sells fast food every day of the week. 

She will use the loan to further strengthen her business and buy basic necessities like rice, beans, oil, instant soups, condiments, and drinks in order to get better profits and increase her sales this December. 

Delfina’s dream is for her business to always be stable and to earn more so that she and her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and instant soups.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina lives in Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister's children).  Safina has a business selling fruit.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Safina sells her products at the market, wholesale.  She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of mangoes, onions, tomatoes, and passion fruit. The main business challenges for Safina include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for fruit and also to open up another branch in the same market.   

Safina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of mangoes, onions, tomatoes and passion friut.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Lolita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia, se dedica a la venta de lácteos y ropa, vive con su dos hijos en casa familiar, el negocio lo empezó hace cinco años debido a la situación económica todos los días vende en el mercado de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más materia prima como: queso, quesillo, crema, cuajada y poder comprar ropa como: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas de esa forma obtener mejores ingresos y tener más clientela.
El objetivo de Silvia es mejorar su inventario  que el negocio crezca y que ella y su familia vivan en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en:
Silvia sells dairy products and clothing. She lives with her two children in the family home. She began the business 5 years ago in response to the economic situation. She sells in the market every day, from Monday to Sunday. 

She will use the loan to buy more basic products like cheese, cream, and curd and to be able to buy clothing like skirts, blouses, pants, and shirts. In this way she will have more income and increase her clientele.   

Silvia’s goal is to grow her inventory so that her business will grow and she and her family will have better living conditions than before.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and curd.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, none of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brother). 

Robinah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Robinah sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling piped water and from houses she rents out.  

The main business challenges for Robinah include the rainy season and transportation.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own  a delivery van to ease transportation  and also to open up another branch in  the market. Robinah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo es albañil y realiza construcciones en obra gruesa y fina; su esposa es comerciante y tiene una tienda de barrio. El crédito es para la compra de material (ladrillos, arena, cemento, piedra) para un contrato de trabajo de construcción que se adjudicó y le significará buenos ingresos. Pablo es casado, tiene cinco hijos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  de Alto Chijini  de la Ciudad de La Paz. El  cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los  créditos otorgados (ya son ocho hasta antes del presente crédito, pagados en forma satisfactoria) ya que le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Esta es la quinta vez que su solicitud es canalizada hacia kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo is a bricklayer and his work consists of building the infrastructure and the finishing details. His wife is a merchant and manages a neighborhood store. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials (bricks, sand, cement, and stone) for a construction contract that he was awarded which will generate good income. Pablo is married and has five children. He lives in his own home in the District of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz.

Pablo is very pleased with the loans he has received since they have helped to increase his income and provide for his family. (He received eight loans prior to this one, all of which have been repaid on time.) This is the fifth time that his request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a construction contract.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Florenda has a shop that sells rice per sack or kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Florenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Florenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Fanis Maritza

texts.es:
Fanis, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 12,15 y 18 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a  la siembra de hortalizas como: pipián, ejotes, chiles, el oficio lo empezó hace diez años debido a la necesidad y todos los días trabajan de lunes a sábado, no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes como: abono, semilla y herbicidas, para las plagas de esa forma podrán tener mejores cosechas este año.
El sueño de Fanis es tener mejores resultados en sus cosechas y mejores ganancias para poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Fanis lives with her husband and three children who are 12, 15, and 18 years old. She and her husband work growing vegetables like squash, green beans, and peppers. Out of necessity she began this job 10 years ago. They work every day between Monday and Saturday, and they don’t have fixed hours. 

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers like manure, seeds, and herbicides because of pests. In this way they can have better harvests this year. 

Fanis’ goal is to have better results with her harvest and more income to be able to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy manure fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Eseza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family.

Eseza has run a beauty salon for 8 years, and she works six days per week. She also sells beauty products in her shop and rents out a room to earn additional income. Eseza has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. 

Eseza's main business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and theft.  Her goals and aspirations are to own a bridal salon and to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing products.

loans.name: Felicetas

texts.en:
Felicetas is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 11 children. 

Felicetas has run a food shop, or sari-sari store, for 50 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Felicetas has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Fadme

texts.es: La señora Fadme trabaja como abogada consultora en uno de los Ministerios Públicos y su esposo es consultor independiente. El crédito lo requiere para pago de maestría en el área legal que es su profesión. Fadme es casada y tiene un hijo .Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona  de Cota Cota de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y por el carácter social-educativo es que se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Fadme works as a consulting attorney for one of the public ministries and her husband is an independent consultant. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for a Master’s degree in law since that is her profession. Fadme is married and has one child. She lives at her parents’ house in the District of Cota Cota in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. Due to her social character and her continuing education, her request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a Master's degree in law.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Gorret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family. She  rents out a room to generate additional income.

Gorret has run a food stall from her home for 10 years, and she works 6 days per week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, onions, and tomatoes. Her main business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and theft. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked food stall and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

For two years, Erlinda has run a food shop, or sari-sari store. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 37, is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has running water and electricity and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, Sarah has operated a tailoring business and her customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Sarah decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Sarah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase cloth and material to sell. She dreams of expanding her business in future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and material

loans.name: Nella

texts.en:
Nella is 38 years old and is married with eight children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, she has run a business making and selling snacks such as rice cakes and pancakes. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Nella is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy the raw ingredients to make snacks. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con sus hijos, ella administra en su hogar una tienda de productos domésticos, sus hijos le ayudan para atender a los clientes, tiene 6 años de estar en el negocio, surgió por iniciativa propia y hoy está bien establecido.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como plásticos, comestibles como pastas, aceite, harina, embutidos, pan, huevos, con esta compra estará surtiendo de variedad el negocio y con la posibilidad de generar más ingresos.
Su objetivo es por medio de los préstamos, poder diversificar el negocio y atender a los clientes de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her children. She runs a store with home products out of her house. Her children help her tend to the customers. She’s had this business for 6 years. It came into being from her own initiative and today it’s well-established. 

She asks for a loan to buy merchandise like plastic products and food like pasta, oil, flour, sausages, bread, and eggs. With this purchase she will have a lot of variety in her stock and the possibility to earn more income. 

Her goal is to use the loans to diversify the business and better serve her customers.

loans.use: to buy plastic products, pasta, oil, flour, sausages, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children, one boy and two girls. She lives in a rental house with electricity and running water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and electricity. For the past six years, Grace has operated a juice-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Grace decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Grace is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to establish an electronics shop and purchase electronics to sell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase electronics and establish a shop

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo es grafico, trabaja como artesano en la elaboración de agendas, recibos y otros; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de Papel ya que se acerca fin de año y tiene varios pedidos de agendas, de tal manera que espera generar ingresos extras para Navidad. Guillermo es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Guillermo es cliente de Impro desde el año  2005 y esta será la tercera vez que desea que su crédito sea enviado a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Guillermo is a graphic designer who produces agendas, receipts, and other documents. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paper. The end of the year is approaching and he has many orders for agendas. He expects that this will generate extra income for Christmas. Guillermo is married and has two children. He lives in his own home in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Guillermo has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and this will be the third time that he wants his loan request sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy paper for fulfilling his year-end orders.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 25 years old and is married with four children. She  lives in the Philippines. For the past two years, Genevieve has run a food shop or sari-sari (variety) store where she sells canned goods, snack, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011

Genevieve is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school. She  lives in Uganda and also takes care of additional orphaned family members. For the past eight years, Nulu has run a business selling charcoal. She works six days out of the week, selling her product wholesale from her home. Nulu also generates additional income through renting rooms. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She lives in a house that she owns without access to electricity or running water. Nulu's major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and feeding her family. 

Nulu is requesting an 80,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations are to start going to the nearby villages for charcoal and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rosalie is buying and selling clothing like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell. Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está soltero, tiene 25 años de edad, administra una foto estudio, vive en casa propia y lleva tres años de estar en el negocio, además vende ropa y películas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva: blusas, faldas, camisetas, también películas en Dvd, para fortalecer el negocio, esto le permitirá diversificar el negocio para ofrecer a los clientes otros servicios.
El objetivo de José es ser más competitivo con el negocio, además de mantener una condición estable con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old and single. He runs a photo studio and lives in his own home. He’s been in this business for 3 years, and he also sells clothes and films. 

Right now he’s asking for a loan to buy new clothes: blouses, skirts, tee shirts, and also DVD films to strengthen his business. This will allow him to diversify the business by offering his customers other services. 

José’s goal is to be more competitive with the business and furthermore to maintain stability with his income.

loans.use: to buy new clothing like blouses, skirts, and tee shirts.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. She belongs to the third gender.

Rosita is providing pedicab or trisikad services. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools for the repair of the pedicab. Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the repair of pedicab

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 7 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Sarah lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and houses for rent. The main business challenges for Sarah include seasonality and thieves.

Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are seeing her business grow big and start selling wholesale and also to start going to villages for charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora Maria Luisa se dedica a comercializar productos de acuerdo a la temporada. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para poner a la venta de juguetes por las fiestas navideñas. Maria Luisa es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda  ubicada en la zona  de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella es cliente de Impro desde el año  2008 y esta es la tercera vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa sells products based on the season. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy toys for the Christmas holidays. Maria Luisa is divorced and has four children. She lives in a rented house in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Maria Luisa has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and this will be the third time that her loan request has been sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell during the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga, vive con sus hijos de 18, 16, 8 años de edad, el mayor de ellos trabaja, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de tortillas y administra un comedor, desde muy temprano inicia los preparativos para el negocio, sus dificultades son el alto costo de algunos productos como el gas que es tan necesario para el cocimiento de los productos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y gas, ya que necesita comprar estos productos para continuar elaborando la comida y las tortillas, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener la mercadería que es vital para la venta.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y prosperar con la ayuda de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Santiaga lives with her children who are 18, 16, and 8 years old. The oldest works. For her part, Santiaga sells tortillas and runs an eatery. She begins the preparations for the business very early. Her difficulties are the high cost of certain products like gas which is very necessary for cooking products. 

She is asking for a loan to buy corn and gas since she needs to buy those products to continue making food and tortillas. This investment will help her maintain the merchandise which is vital for sales. 

Her dream is to grow the business, improve living conditions for her children, and prosper with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy corn and gas.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Jane has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands. Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 6 years, Pauline has operated a green grocery business, selling to local residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuation in prices. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mercelina

texts.en:
Mercelina is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water but not electricity. She faces a major challenge of school fees and rent bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the local market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a motorcycle business which earns her other income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her operations.  Mercelina dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for her transport business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another "boda boda" (motorcycle) for transport business.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: La señora Eduarda  se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y además es rentista jubilada. El crédito que requiere es para traslado  de tierra  y apertura de garaje en su domicilio.  Eduarda  es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Su condición de mujer emprendedora la hace merecedora de este préstamo.
texts.en: Sra. Eduarda prepares and sells food.  She is also a retired pensioner.  The loan she is requesting will be used to complete a transfer of land and to add a garage to her home.  Eduarda is a widow and has three children.  She lives in her home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.  Her condition as a female entrepreneur makes her worthy of this loan.

loans.use: to complete a transfer of land and to add a garage to her home.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has seven children, two of whom are in school.  Hadjah   has a business selling used clothes.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  

Hadjah   sells her products at the market, retail.  She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes.   The main business challenges for Hadjah   include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build rental rooms.  

 Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fish, lobster and shells.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jose has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for one year. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jose hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Marichel has a internet shop that provides encoding & internet services . She has had this business for  three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the electricity for the internet cafe.

Marichel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marichel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for the internet cafe.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Josie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy marañón seeds.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria trabaja como artesana en plomería, realizando codos y cajas, las cuales vende en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. Ella está divorciada y tiene dos hijos. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de tubos para continuar fabricando los accesorios de plomería y generar sus ingresos de la venta de los mismos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito y su historial de pagos es excelente. Ana Maria vive en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Maria produces handmade plumbing fittings, such as joints and pump boxes. She sells them at the main fair in the city of El Alto. She is divorced and has two children. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tubes so that she can continue producing plumbing accessories and generating income from her sales.

This is the second time she has requested a loan and her payment history is excellent. Ana Maria lives in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy tubes for making plumbing joints and pump boxes.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both in school. She also takes care of her sister and brother. 

Caroline has a poultry farming business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works six days out of the week. Caroline sells her products at retail from home. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. The main business challenges for Caroline include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see it grow big, to own 2000 chickens and to start selling at wholesale. 

Caroline lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Dalila Sarai

texts.es: Dalila,  solicita un préstamo para la compra de unas carretas de leña y quintales de maíz, además de dos comales, esto para continuar en su dedicación a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio ha mejorado por las inversiones anteriores, esto la ha motivado a continuar siendo buena cliente para gozar de este beneficio.
texts.en: Dalila is requesting a loan to buy some carts of firewood and quintals of corn, as well as two ‘comales’, the pans used for cooking tortillas. She needs all this to continue her work making and selling tortillas. Her business has improved thanks to previous investments, which has motivated her to continue being a good client to enjoy this benefit.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and pans for cooking tortillas.

loans.name: Gerardo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Gerardo, necesita realizar la reparación de su moto taxi, por eso solicita nuevamente un préstamo, para pagar el mecánico y comprar los repuestos necesarios, el se animo a solicitar porque tiene un buen historial créditos, además que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para hacer las reparaciones.
Él está agradecido por la oportunidad que ha tenido con estos préstamos, ya que compro llantas y otros gastos que le debía hacer a la moto taxi.
texts.en:
Gerardo needs to get his motorcycle taxi repaired. He is requesting a new loan to pay the mechanic and buy the spare parts required. He resolved to request the loan because he has a good credit history, and he does not have the money to pay for the repairs himself. 
He is grateful for the opportunities he has received with these loans. Thanks to them, he has been able to buy tires and pay for other expenses also related to the motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to repair his motorcycle taxi.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice 28, is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetable, fruit and tomatoes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetable, fruit and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passerby. She faces a major challenge of low sales in her business. Her major dream is to expand the business to meet her customer demand. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for hired help to gather the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase basic products to make incense.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria trabaja en un colegio del país, tiene planes de ir cambiando la infraestructura de su vivienda. Junto a su esposo y los financiamientos han logrado realizar mejoras a su casa, anteriormente cambio el techo de la parte de la sala y cuarto. Actualmente con este nuevo préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: inodoros que no se tiene actualmente, tubería de pvc, pega para pvc, perlines, goloso, plycem, láminas de zinc,  entre otros materiales, para construir el  servicio higiénico, con esta obra  va a  disminuir la posibilidad de contraer enfermedades. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo constante que le permite ir cumpliendo con sus planes, proyectos y objetivo de mejorar su nivel de vida, obtener comodidades y seguridad a la misma vez.
texts.en:
Gloria works in a public high school, and she has plans to change the infrastructure of her house. Along with her husband and financing they have been able to make home improvements, previously changing the roof over part of the living room and bedroom. 

Currently, with this new loan, she will buy construction materials such as: toilets which she doesn't currently have, PVC piping, glue for PVC, purlins, bolts, fiberboard, and zinc sheeting, among other materials, to build a bathroom. With this work the possibility of contracting illnesses will be diminished. 

She is thankful to the microfinance institution for its constant support that allows her to finish her plans, projects and objective of bettering her quality of life, obtaining comfort and security at the same time.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria, se ha decidido nuevamente por un préstamo, para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, comprando madera y pagando la mano de obra para que le hagan la reparación necesaria en uno de sus cuartos principales, espera con esta inversión poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición, ella ha tenido buenas experiencias con el trabajo estos préstamos, por eso está decidida a continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Maria has decided to request another loan in order to make improvements to her home by purchasing wood and paying for laborers to do the necessary repairs in one of the main rooms. She hopes that with this investment she can offer her family better conditions. She has had good experiences with her work. For this reason, she has decided to continue working.

loans.use: purchase wood and helps with payments for laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Thumu

texts.en: Thumu is taking another Kiva loan of Kes 40,000 to boost her beauty salon business, where she serves her neighbours and passersby. With the loan she wants to purchase beauty products and a blow dryer. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es chofer propietario  y es miembro de un sindicato de trufis (son taxis que tienen una ruta fija). El crédito que solicita es para el mantenimiento total de su movilidad ya que es su herramienta de trabajo. Juan es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la Urbanización El Mercedario de la Ciudad de El Alto. Juan es cliente de Impro desde al año 2009, siendo esta la quinta vez que solicita un crédito y la tercera vez que recurre a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is an independent driver and a member of a syndicate of “trufis” (taxis that have a fixed route). The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for total maintenance of his vehicle since it is the main piece of equipment he uses for work. Juan is married and has two children. He lives in a rented house in the urban section of El Mercedario in the city of El Alto.

Juan has been a client of IMPRO since 2009. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan, but the third time he has returned to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy 26, is a single mother who lives in a family house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is high cost of transport.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to install water pipes in her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to install water pipes in her house.

loans.name: Maudi

texts.es: Maudi, de 14 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dinámica, así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Marco quien es empleado. Vive en compañía de madre, hermana, su pareja y su hijo de 5 meses de edad, instalados cómodamente en la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Maudi es la venta de bebidas gaseosa, contando con una congeladora que compró con el apoyo de su pareja, e iniciándose con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros comprando una caja de bebida gaseosa para empezar. Su ventas lo realiza todo el día desde y por las noches vende comida rápida como pollos broaster y salchicha con pollo frito, para eso cuenta con un carrito sanguchero. Ella realiza ambas actividades desde hace 2 años, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la atención hacia los clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y cuidar de su hijo, así como los ingresos le sirven para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar. Gracias  a las buenas ganancias que ha tenido por la  regular clientela que maneja, desea continuar con su negocio y ampliarlo y en un futuro tener un distribuidora de bebidas gaseosas. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP,  está agradecida con el apoyo financiero ya que gracias a ello avanzará con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de bebidas como aseosas a precio por mayor para de esa manera tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Maudi, a 14-year-old, is a dynamic and enterprising woman. She is also happy and kind, and she lives with Marco, who is employed. She lives in the company of her mother, her sister, her boyfriend, and their five-month-old son, all in her mother's house.

Maudi's business is selling soft drinks. She depends on a freezer that she bought with the support of her boyfriend. She got her start with capital which came from her own savings and was used to purchase a case of soft drinks to begin with.

She sells all day long, and at night she sells fast food such as roasted chicken and sausage with fried chicken. For that work she counts on her food cart. She has been doing both of these activities for two years, relying on help from her mother for customer service. She likes her business because it allows her to stay home and take care of her son, and the income helps her pay for household expenses.

Thanks to good earnings from regular customers she handles, she wants to continue with the business and expand into soft drink distribution in the future. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is thankful for the financial support. Thanks to this she will be able to move forward with her business. With the amount she requested, 800 nuevos soles, she will invest it entirely in buying drinks such as sodas at wholesale prices in order to have a bigger profit margin.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es: María, necesita continuar fortaleciendo el negocio, comprara arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carnes, vegetales, condimentos, para continuar ofreciendo a los clientes los platillos con el sabor de calidad, con los préstamos anteriores ha logrado hacer una buena inversión, dando un mejor servicio a los clientes y manteniendo el negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Maria needs to continue strengthening her business. By buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, meat, vegetables, and condiments, she will continue offering her customers dishes with a quality taste. With previous loans she was able to make a good investment, giving better service to her customers and keeping her business well supplied.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, meat, vegetables, and condiments.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo, ya que quiere darle continuidad al fortalecimiento del negocio, en esta ocasión quiere comprar pólvora, bebidas y productos domésticos, para poder afrontar la demanda.
Estos préstamos le han permitido mejorar y contar con más clientes y ventas, espera ser buen cliente y pagar con puntualidad para seguir gozando de este servicio.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan once again, since he would like to continue strengthening his business. On this occasion, he wants to buy powder, beverages, and home products so that he can fulfill the demand from his customers.

These loans have allowed him to improve and to increase his sales and number of customers. He plans to be a good client and make his payments punctually so he can continue to enjoy the benefits of this service.

loans.use: to buy powder, beverages and home products.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her business. With this loan, she wants to connect water pipes in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet customer demand in the future. She faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes

loans.name: Dinora Marlene

texts.es:
Dinora, vive con su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, es empleada de una maquila, lleva un año trabajando.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frisser, ya que tiene un negocio en su casa de venta de bebidas, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener frías las gaseosas, jugos, para vender  a los clientes.
La aspiración de ella es hacer una buena inversión con el préstamo, tener resultados positivos ya que su familia cuenta con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora lives with her husband and her five year old daughter. She works at a factory. She has been working there for one year.
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a freezer since she now has a business selling beverages in her home. This investment will help her keep the soft drinks and juices cold while selling them to customers.
Her aspirations are to make a good investment with the loan and to have good results since her family counts on the income.

loans.use: purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: Narda, de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está separada, vive en compañía de su madre y sus hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad que son su motivación para seguir trabajando, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Narda es la venta de hielo y los reparte entre los negocios de sus vecinos que se dedican a la venta de bebidas heladas, haciendo entregas a domicilio o puesto de venta. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de raspadillas (hielo con esencia de frutas) en el frontis de la casa de sus padres. Para estos negocios cuenta con una congeladora que le regaló su hermano quien a su vez le dio la iniciativa de iniciarse en ese negocio realizándola ella sola desde hace 3 años. Le agrada su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y tener libertad de tiempo para atender a su madre que está mal de salud, así como el ingreso económico con el cual se ayuda para los gastos de su hogar y de sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Ahora viendo la buena acogida que tiene su negocio desea seguir avanzando y ampliarlo. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Narda is a 48 year old, hard-working and earnest woman.  She is separated and lives with her mother and children ages 15 and 12, who are her motivation to keep working.  They all live comfortably in her mother's house.  Narda has a business selling ice.   She distributes it among her neighbor's businesses who sell beverages, making deliveries to homes and sales stands.  She also sells raspadillas (ice with fruit flavoring) in front of her parents house.  For these businesses she has a freezer that was given to her by her brother who proposed that she start this business.  She has been doing it for 3 years now.  She likes this business as it allows her to be home and have the free time to care for her mother who is in poor health.  The income also helps with the household expenses as well as the expenses of her children, whom she loves very much.  Now, realizing how well-received her business is, she wants to continue to advance and expand it.  

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She feels grateful for the line of credit so she can advance her business.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  With the 800 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] requested she will buy soft drinks at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase beverages to expand her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Jane faces a challenge of rising prices of commodities in her business. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell her products in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of second hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén, actualmente  vive solo, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de ganado, atiende las labores agropecuarias por las mañanas y después trabaja en un molino de maíz, son sus dos ocupaciones.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para alimentar el ganado y los cerdos, ya que no tiene lo suficiente para los próximos meses, esta inversión le ayudara para que sus animales tengan la alimentación necesaria.
El sueño de Rubén es tener la granja de cerdos más grande, comprar buena calidad de ganado y con el préstamo tener una buena experiencia y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Currently, Rubén lives alone. He is engaged in raising pigs and cattle. Attending to his agricultural labors in the mornings and afterwards working in a corn mill are his two jobs.
